The book includes a number of detailed episode templates to help cut down on prep time, as well as introduces new rules for nemesis characters and organisations to challenge the heroes. Armed with the resources found in this toolkit, a GM will always be ready for action.

(From back of product)

65256.name: Dragons of Krynn
65256.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Dragons.

The undisputed masters of Krynn.

The stuff of legends for over a thousand years.

Whether encountered alone in their lairs beneath the ruins of ancient cities or flying in great numbers over the battlefields of Solamnia, dragons are the icons of fear and hope in the unfolding drama of the DRAGONLANCE world.

This volume offers authorial insights, creative perspectives, cultural legends, and factual accounts of the marvelous wyrms of Krynn from the ten clans of true dragons and their myriad kindred to the indomitable breeds of draconians. New racial classes, new feats, and a collection of dragon-themed magic items are provided. The bakali lizardfolk and their offshoots are presented in full detail, together with rules and background for dragonspawn, dragonkin, and the noble draconians.

rpgseries: Leaves from the Inn of the Last Home
65257.name: Lost Leaves from the Inn of the Last Home
65257.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Bill of Fare

Hail, Traveler! Welcome to the Inn of the Last Home.

You visit us during the Fourth Age, a time of war, when the Gods of Light and Darkness battle for the lands of Ansalon. But, for now, forget the dangers of the road. Wash away the dust with our finest ale, as you eat your fill of Otik’s spiced potatoes. Relax by the fire and listen to the old man’s tales of knights who ride to battle on the backs of dragons. Pay no heed to the strange-looking mage who watches from the shadows, though with the kender about, you might want to keep your hands on your purse!

Rest well in our inn this night, friend, for on the morrow you may wake to the beating of the drums of war...

For Your Enjoyment, We Offer
Tales of men and dragons in a time of conflict.
Scrolls containing ancient magic and relics of the gods.
Legends of wolf-bonded warriors and kender knights.
Forgotten lore of goblins, the crafting of dwarven jewelry, and more.
Feast traditions and recipes gathered by our own Tika Waylan.
Songs of the era, with both music and lyrics.

65262.description:
From Hasbro.com:
"Challenge a friend to checker-dropping fun with CONNECT 4! There are three ways to play, so choose your game:

Original: Drop in your checkers and be the first to get 4-in-a-row to win.

Pop Out: Get 4 in a row by popping a checker out instead of dropping one in!

Pop 10: Pop checkers out of the grid. If your checker is part of a 4-in-a-row, you get to keep it. The first player to get 10 checkers wins.

When you're done playing, tote your game around with a convenient carrying handle. The checkers store inside the grid so you're ready to play anytime!"

Contents:
42 checkers (21 yellow, 21 red)
Grid with checker catcher base/handle
Instructions
65262.name: Connect 4 (Revised Edition)

65263.name: Deadlands: Reloaded GM Screen
65263.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Dead men tell no tales, whether they've quit walking or not, and the Weird West is filled with secrets. This three-panel landscaped screen helps a wily Deadlands Marshal keep his plans close to his chest as well as providing easy reference to eleven of the handiest charts west o' the Mississippi, including an expansive list of combat options and maneuvers. The landscape panels still let you see the action on the table top without sealing you behind a wall of mighty redwoods, but the heavy hardback construction is nearly that strong.

Murder on the Hellstromme Express, a 32-page new adventure by Matt Cutter is also included in the package. Take a ride on one of the most advanced trains of the day, barreling out of Chicago straight for the Kansas Scientific Exposition and the cutthroat competition to win a contract with Hellstromme Industries. After all, what can go wrong on a train full of competitive Mad Scientists who routinely tinker until reality has been bent (or straightened) to their will? What will your posse do with all that time on their hands, much less the axle grease and the blood?

Three Panel, landscaped format, with 32 page b&w adventure.

65264.name: Cyberpunk DataPack Utility
65264.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Each Dossier Pak comes with four full sets of Dossiers - heavy gauge folders imprinted with your character record - designed to hold Giri Sheets, notes, information and reference sheets. A pack of Giri Sheets is also included.

65265.name: The Collectors: The Burning House
65265.description:
Publisher Blurb:

The players portray demons sent to the mortal realm to fetch a soul that is owed to Him. That is, owed to the Master. The Chair. The Executive. The Home Office.

They have been given equipment and identities, and a task which seems at first glance very easy: simply locate the client, explain their purpose, and drag him -- kicking and screaming if necessary -- back to Processing.

Of course, things are never that easy. . . .

65267.name: Darksummer Nights
65267.description:
Publisher Blurb:

DarkSummer Nights is the first RunePunk supplement and builds upon the unique setting by offering the street-level detail that the fans have demanded. Within the pages are a highly detailed gazetteer of the borough of the City's capital of DarkSummer, including dozens of new personalities, plot hooks, new groups, and opportunities for adventure. Broken Dreams forms the second half of the book and amplifies and expands the intrigues of DarkSummer with a comprehensive adventure that highlights many of the characters and groups found within the borough. Tell your jobbers to get ready, DarkSummer awaits! Using the award winning Savage Worlds engine and building upon the unique vision that is RunePunk, Darksummer Nights is worth the wait.

65268.name: Karawanenspuren
65268.description:
User Summary:

An adventure anthology, stressing the southern / oriental part of Aventurien. Supplementing the regional sourcebook "G5: Land der ersten Sonne".

From the back of the book:

Längst vergessene Geheimnisse liegen verschüttet im Wüstensand und überwuchert in den Sümpfen, in unzugänglichen Bergtälern und morastigen Seen. Wo in den alten Zeiten die ersten Menschen lebten und die Echsen einst ihr glanzvolles Reich errichtet hatten, wo angeblich Giganten und Drachen kämpften und wo sich Rastullah, der All-Eine, dem Volk der Novadis offenbarte, dort harren zahlreiche Geheimnisse ihrer Entdeckung. Wo Mensch und Tier in unbarmherziger Hitze, gefährlichen Sumpflöchern und tödlichen Erdrutschen vergehen, stellt sich die Natur selbst als unbarmherzigster Gegner heraus.

Im begleitenden Abenteuerband zur Regionalspielhilfe Raschtuls Atem führen die Abenteuer Imuhar, In den Schluchten des Raschtulswalls, Gefängnis der Jahre, Echsenjäger und Im Zeichen des Löwen auf einer abwechslungsreichen und gefährlichen Reise durch die Länder unter Raschtuls Atem, ergänzt durch einige weitere Szenarioideen. Folgen Sie den Karawanenspuren in fremde Länder!

65269.name: Fluch vergangener Zeiten
65269.description:
User Summary:

Anthology of the two winning adventures submitted to the competition of the Hannover Spielt in 2001/2002.

Contains the adventures:

- An den Quellen des Harotrud
- Der Reigen der fünf Schwestern

65270.name: Klar zum Entern
rpgissuearticle: Pirat setzt Kopfgelder auf Kapitäne und Handelsherren aus
65270.description:
User Summary:

Campaign module set in the southern seas of Aventurien, dealing with trade and piracy on a large scale. Also, rules for naval combat are included in the module.

From the back of the book:

Südaventurien ist von den umwälzenden Veränderungen der letzten Jahre verschont geblieben: Der Krieg gegen den Dämonenmeister und seine Erben und das Jahr des Feuers gingen an jemandem, der in Brabak oder Al'Anfa lebt, fast spurlos vorüber. Aus diesem Grund blieb im Norden auch weitgehend unbemerkt, dass sich in der Charyptik, dem südlichen Perlenmeer, ein Konflikt zuspitzt, der bereits seit mehreren Jahrzehnten schwelt: der Kampf um den Reichtum der Waldinseln, um Kolonien und Versorgungshäfen. Ein Kampf, der von den beteiligten Mächten, dem Bornland, der Schwarzen Allianz Al'Anfas und der Goldenen Allianz aus dem Königreich Brabak, Horas- und Kemireich - mit Dolch und Gift, Flottenmanövern und Handelsblockaden geführt wird.

Und genau in diesen Konflikt geraten die Helden: Ehe sie sich versehen, sind sie Teil des Geflechts aus konkurrierenden Interessen der Kauffahrer und Admiräle, Freibeuter und unabhängigen Piraten - ein vielleicht entscheidender Teil, dass die neue Phase des Kampfs um die Kolonien soll mit schnellen und spektakulären Siegen entschieden werden. Ob an Bord stolzer Schiffe, in den Hinterzimmern verräucherter Kaschemmen oder im undurchdringlichen Dschungel - oft genug steht der Erfolg auf Entermessers Schneide.

65271.name: Questadores
65271.description:
User Summary:

An adventure anthology for DSA/TDE dealing with the far south of Aventurien, consisting of jungle, colonial cities and Caribbean flair. Supplements the regional sourcebook "In den Dschungeln Meridianas".

From the back of the book:

Questadores – so nennt man in Meridiana die Glücksritter und Abenteurerinnen; tollkühne Gesellen, die von den Gerüchten über versunkene Tempelpyramiden, sagenhafte Reichtümer und rauschende Feste angelockt werden. In großer Zahl strömen sie aus dem ganzen Kontinent gen Süden, doch nur wenige kehren zurück ...

Von der Grünen Hölle des Regenwalds auf das heiße Pflaster Al'Anfas, von den knarrenden Planken einer Piratenkaravelle an den exotischen Hof der Kemikönigin – die fünf Abenteuer dieses Bandes ergänzen die Regionalspielhilfe In den Dschungeln Meridianas und stellen eine farbenprächtige Reise durch die Kulturen, Gefahren und Geheimnisse des aventurischen Südens dar: Leichte Beute von Uta Enners und Stefan Trautmann, Das Erbe des Magiers und Der Widerspenstigen Rettung von Heike Wolf, Kamaluqs Rache von Philipp Schumann und Boronsfurcht von Perry Steven und Anja Jäcke.

Neben den fünf sofort spielbaren Kurzabenteuern bietet Questadores eine Reihe weiterer Szenarioideen und Abenteuervorschläge sowie Hinweise, wie sich Teile des Romans Rabengeflüster am Spieltisch umsetzen lassen.

65272.description:
Description from BoardgameNews.com:

While Cyrano de Bergerac was a real person, Cyrano is based on the play Cyrano de Bergerac, written more than two hundred years after Cyrano’s death. In both the play and the game, Cyrano writes poetry to woo a woman for another man. The game Cyrano lasts a number of rounds, and each round starts with a player revealing a theme card and two rhyme cards ("-aid", "-ed" and so on with homonyms being acceptable). Each player then composes a quatrain (a poem of four lines) with two of the lines ending with one of the rhymes and the other two ending with the other rhyme. Players read their poems and score points Boggle-style, with each unique ending word being worth one point; these points are recorded by blacking out squares on a ladder, which represents the lover’s climb toward his object of affection.

Everyone then secretly votes on which poem he or she most appreciated, whether for its beauty, adherence to theme, or some other artistic qualification. Players reveal their votes simultaneously, and for each player who voted the same way you did, you receive one point, with these points being recorded by the maiden’s descent from the tower. Whichever player first brings the loves onto the same floor of the tower wins, with ties being broken by a rhyming duel.
65272.name: Cyrano
boardgamepodcastepisode: C&C Episode 2. A review on Cyrano.

65273.name: Critter Encounters: Bugged Out
65273.description:
From the Publisher's Website:

Blackdirge Publishing and Goodman Games bring you Critter Encounters, a line of short encounter scenarios for the Fourth Edition Dungeons & Dragons game. Each Critter Encounter can be played in a single gaming session, and can be easily slotted into nearly any fantasy campaign. Critter Encounters is the companion line to Critter Cache, published by Blackdirge Publishing and Goodman Games, and features monsters from that line. However, every Critter Encounters includes complete stat blocks for all monsters.

Critter Encounters: Bugged Out is a short scenario for the Fourth Edition Dungeons & Dragons game that revolves around mysterious disappearances in the small town of Kettledowns. Townsfolk are disappearing in the night, spirited away by some force that burrows up beneath homes and businesses, leaving an empty, ransacked shambles in its wake. It will take a canny and brave group of heroes to solve the mystery, and bring peace and prosperity back to Kettledowns.


Critter Encounters: Bugged Out features the following: A ready-to-play 4E scenario for characters of 6th to 8th level
Dynamic encounter areas, with full color maps by SkeletonKey Games’ Ed Bourelle
Complete stat blocks for all monsters, traps, and hazards
Advice on how to tailor the scenario to parties of various levels
Full-size monster counters for all monsters in the scenario
Fabulous illustrations by Jesse Mohn

65277.name: Minotaur (Issue 5 - Summer 2009)
rpgissuearticle: A Twist in the Maze : (Not Quite) the Art of Ancient Warfare
Adventure: The Secret of Zerzura (Part One)
Mythic Bestiary : Denizens of the Desert
Mythika Gazetteer : Observations of the Desert Kingdom
Variant Characters : Heroes of the Desert
65277.description:
From publisher blurb:

This double-sized, 57-page issue takes you to the Desert Kingdom, Mythika's equivalent of ancient Egypt, with a massive 50-page feature on the land of pyramids, mummies and weird beast-headed deities. Includes two scenarios, a fully-detailed gazetteer, new creatures and mythic items, optional rules etc.

65278.name: Minotaur (Issue 6 - Fall 2009)
rpgissuearticle: A Twist in the Maze : Adventures & Advancement
Adventure: Temple of the Black Goat
Adventure: The Secret of Zerzura (Part Two)
Interview : Carlos de la Cruz Morales
Maze Master’s Lore : The Other Gods
Official Oracle: TWIST AGAIN IN THE MAZE
Pandora’s Box : Bazaar of the Bizarre
65278.description:
From publisher blurb:

This double-sized, 55-page issue includes a complete gazetteer on Hyperborea, home of the northern Barbarians, two adventures, a special feature on the fine art of designing new creatures for M&M, eldritch lore on the darker deities of Mythika, as well as the usual assortment of new creatures, mythic items and optional rules.

65279.name: Tomb of the Mummy King
65279.description:
From the Publisher:

A Gamemaster Adventure for Tunnels and Trolls.

Deep in the forested fastness north of the Kingdom there is an ancient, forgotten place, the last remnant of a civilization long gone from the world: the Forest of the Forgotten! In the centre of this forest is a Tomb, the last resting place of a king whose works are long lost, but whose name lives on in legend, Kharis, the mummy King.

For the last five generations the Tomb of Kharis the Mummy King has attracted the adventurers of the Kingdom; those desperate or foolhardy enough to make the dangerous trek to the Forest of the Forgotten.

65280.name: GameMastery Flip-Mat: Keep
65280.description:
From the Publisher's Website:

Flip Mat: Keep features a small fortress with a courtyard, stables, well, barracks, and battlements. The map includes numerous interior chambers, such as the throne room, war room, and grand entry hall, all of which make for perfect adventure sites. The Flip side features the broken terrain that might lead up to the keep.

Flip Mat: Keep measures 24" x 30" unfolded and 8" x 10" folded.

GameMastery Flip-Mats are designed to make your game portable and affordable. They're made with durable, laminated card stock and can handle dry erase, wet erase, and even permanent marker!

Usable by experienced GMs and novices alike, this product fits perfectly into any Game Master's arsenal!

65281.name: Doctor Strange: Through Six Dimensions
65281.description:
Marvel Super Heroes Adventure Gamebook #4

From back cover:

You are Doctor Strange, Sorceror Supreme, sworn to protect Earth at all costs. The six sorcerors from the realm of Trofane manifest themselves all at once in the body of your manservant, Wong. They bring terrible news: Earth is about to become a battleground more deadly than any human conflict could create. This is a fight between different dimensions and you must act immediately if Earth is to be saved from total annihilation!

MARVEL SUPER HEROES Adventure Gamebooks are based on TSR, Inc's popular MARVEL SUPER HEROES role-playing game, but you needn't know the game to enjoy the exciting adventure in this book. All you need to do is get one standard, six-sided die, summon your cloak of levitation and Eye of Agamotto, and assume the role of Doctor Strange as he seeks to save Earth from certain destruction in THROUGH SIX DIMENSIONS.

65282.description:
Tanto Cuore is a Japanese deck-building card game which has a mechanism similar to Dominion.

Each player plays as the Lord of a mansion and hires maids to fill out their house to become the King of Maids! The end goal is simple enough, the player who has the most Victory Points at the end of the game wins! Players acquire Victory Points by employing a variety of maids and "Love" cards that allow for different strategies. You can even employ Private Maids that stick around to use their special powers each per turn! Some give you a bonus, or affect your opponents in a negative way. But beware, your opponents can make your maids sick or give them bad habits, affecting your maids in negative ways and decreasing your Victory Points!

The game art is in the Japanese anime style and uses the theme of maids commonly seen in anime! All of the cards, dividers and manual fit into an easy to transport box so you can easily take the game with you wherever you want.
65282.name: Tanto Cuore
boardgameexpansion: Tanto Cuore: Aino Svensen
Tanto Cuore: Arisa Hayakawa - Tabletop Day 2016
Tanto Cuore: Kickstarter Big Box and Maid Randomizer
Tanto Cuore: Oktoberfest – Gina Kersten Promo Card
Tanto Cuore: Private Maid – Ursula Fassbender
Tanto Cuore: Promo Card Set #1

65283.name: Dragon (Issue 176 - Dec 1991)
rpgissuearticle: If You Need Help - Ask the Drow!
The Voyage of the Princess Ark
65283.description:
Dragon Magazine
Vol. XVI, No. 7
Issue #176
December 1991

"The elves: a world of difference - Two in-depth features on the elves and their beliefs."

Cover art by Lissanne Lake.

65284.name: Red Dwarf: Series Sourcebook
65284.description:
From the back of the book:

Brutal.
Hot on the heels of the acclaimed Red Dwarf - The Roleplaying Game and the Red Dwarf A.I. Screen and Extra Bits Book comes the most indispensible resource for Red Dwarf adventure gaming!
Within this book, you will find every episode of the popular BBC Sci-Fi comedy, broken down into playable elements for use in your own Red Dwarf Campaign!
Plot synopses, variations and hooks, fully statted characters, creatures, ships and gear, all ready to play!
What are you waiting for, a purple alert?

rpg: Legend of the Five Rings (3rd Edition)
65285.name: Way of the Open Hand
65285.description:
User summary:

A free PDF supplement for Legend of the Five Rings 3rd Edition. Details styles of martial arts employed throughout the Empire.

65286.name: Septimus Quickstart
65286.description:
From inside the cover:
Welcome to SEPTIMUS: FIRE & FORGET, a free role-playing game of hard-hitting science fiction adventure set in a distant future. This is the Free RPG Day version of SEPTIMUS, a forthcoming RPG from West End Games, so what you will find here is a bit of background, some quickstart rules and everything else you will need to play a bare-bones session of this game.

65288.description:
Pick-A-Part is memory with more to it. There are two sets of cards; large cards that show full drawings, and smaller cards that show individual parts of the full drawings. Each full drawing on a large card consists of three main parts. Therefor there are three small cards for each large card.

Both sets of cards are put face down on the playing area. You can choose to mix the large and small cards together in one group, or to have them as two separate groups.

In a turn a player first flips over one of the large cards which will show a full drawing. For example: A bird in a nest on a branch. Then the player flips over a small card, trying to match it with the full drawing on the large card that's already flipped over. In the example mentioned, a matching small card should show a drawing of either the bird, the nest or the branch.

If no match is made, both the large and small cards are to be flipped over again, face down. If a match is made, the player gets to keep only the small card; the large card has to be flipped over again. However, if the matching small card is the last of the small cards remaining for the specific large card, then the player gets to keep both cards.

A player is allowed another turn whenever he/she is able to collect a small tile. If a player collects both a large and a small card, it's the next players' turn.

Should a player overlook the fact that the collected small card was the last one of the set remaining, and flip over the large card so that it is facing down again instead of collecting it, then any player in his/her own turn can still collect this large card. A player doing so has to mention that the large card he/she collects does not have any of its small cards remaining. Collecting a single large card also means that it's the next players' turn.
A player that overlooks to collect a large card does however get another turn since he/she did collect a small card. He/she can still use this extra turn to collect the large card, so other players are warned not to rejoice openly to quickly as this might trigger him/her to do just that!

If a player collects a large card, the remaining large cards have to be shuffled.
Whenever a single player manages to collect a full set of cards (1 large card and its 3 small cards), all remaining cards (large and small) have to be shuffled.

The game ends when there are no more cards to be collected. To determine the winner, the cards are counted and scored as follows:


1 point for each small card
2 points for each large card (except for the last collected large card; No points for that!)
3 bonus points for each complete set of cards (1 large card and its 3 small cards)


The player that gets the most points is the winner.
65288.name: Pick-A-Part

65291.name: JAG-GER The Strategy Jigsaw Game
65291.description:
From the back of the box:

"JAG-GER is the first true family game in years. Children compete equally with adults. The puzzles are hexagonal in shape and fit on a tray board. The difficulty level of each board is determined by two factors: the number of pieces in a puzzle - 25, 50, 75, 100, 150, 200, 250, 300 - and the difficulty of the puzzle picture - Levels 1-5, 5 being the most difficult. Refill puzzles are available for all ages and skill levels. With every purchase of a refill, JAG-GER is a new game".

Contents listed as 54 score cards, 2 game boards. 2 puzzles (each are 100 pieces). The box bottom of mine shows a beautiful mountain lake photo with flowers in the foreground and a photo of a Germanic/medieval looking building beside a canal with a covered bridge.

65294.name: The Created: Lesser Golems
65294.description:
Blackdirge’s Bargain Bestiaries kicks off with The Created - Lesser Golems, featuring 5 new golems created by spellcasters who don’t have the resources or skill to create a stone golem or iron golem. From the disgusting dung golem to the exquisitely crafted wood golem, lesser golems may be cheap, but they can still pack a wallop. So give your heroic-tier NPCs spellcasters a little animated muscle for the next time a bunch of ill-mannered PCs kick down their door in search of loot and XP.


Blackdirge’s Bargain Bestiaries: The Created: Lesser Golems features 5 all new lesser golems for your 4E game: Dung Golem:(Level 3 Elite Brute)
Glass Golem:(Level 8 Elite Soldier)
Straw Golem:(Level 1 Elite Skirmisher)
Wax Golem:(Level 6 Elite Controller)
Wood Golem:(Level 10 Elite Brute)

65295.name: From Beyond: Aberrant Horrors
65295.description:
From Publisher's Website:

Blackdirge’s Bargain Bestiaries continues with From Beyond: Aberrant Horrors, featuring 5 new aberrations guaranteed to add a bit of the bizarre to your 4E game. Often disgusting and always strange, the aberrations in From Beyond: Aberrant Horrors range from mildly disturbing to outright mind-shatteringly weird. So keep your players guessing and your evil-DM inclinations well fed with Blackdirge’s Bargain Bestiaries: From Beyond - Aberrant Horrors.

Blackdirge’s Bargain Bestiaries: From Beyond - Aberrant Horrors features 5 all-new aberrations for your 4E game:


Chaos Kraken: (Level 24 Elite Controller)
Creeping Maw: (Level 18 Elite Lurker)
Grethling: (Level 4 Lurker)
Varghul: (Level 9 Skirmisher)
Warptail Watcher: (Level 13 Elite Soldier)

65296.name: Hybrid Horrors: Dragon-Blooded
65296.description:
From the Publisher's Website:

Blackdirge’s Bargain Bestiaries continues with Hybrid Horrors - Dragon-Blooded, featuring 4 new monsters, each a strange and powerful creature born of the union of dragon and beast. From the deadly absurdity of the dracotrice to the terrible power of the riddling dracosphinx, the dragon-blooded crossbreeds in this installment of Blackdirge’s Bargain Bestiaries are guaranteed to give you a double dose of monstrous goodness.

Blackdirge’s Bargain Bestiaries: Hybrid Horrors - Dragon-Blooded features 4 all new dragon-blooded hybrids for your 4E game:

Dracogriff: (Level 9 Elite Brute)
Dracolisk: (Level 12 Elite Controller)
Dracosphinx: (Level 19 Solo Soldier)
Dracotrice: (Level 7 Elite Skirmisher)

65297.name: Creepy Critters: Baleful Bugs
65297.description:
From the Publisher's Website:

You can never have enough giant creepy crawlies to terrorize and disgust your players. So with that in mind, Blackdirge’s Bargain Bestiaries gives you five new oversized insects and arachnids in Creepy Critters: Baleful Bugs. From the lurking menace of the sand devil to the aerial terror of the giant dragonfly, Blackdirge’s Bargain Bestiaries: Creepy Critters - Baleful Bugs is sure to fill your players’ nightmares with buzzing wings, venomous stingers, and crushing mandibles.

Blackdirge’s Bargain Bestiaries: Creepy Critters - Baleful Bugs features 5 new giant insects and arachnids for your 4E game:

Carrion Fly Swarm: (Level 3 Skirmisher)
Giant Dragonfly: (Level 7 Skirmisher)
Puppeteer Spider: (Level 12 Elite Controller)
Sand Devil: (Level 9 Elite Lurker)
Scourgetail Scorpion: (Level 5 Skirmisher)

65299.name: World War II Heroes - Players Guide
rpgissuearticle: Review of World War II Heroes
65299.description:
From the back of the book

Experience the excitement, danger and heroism of squad-level conflict on the battlefields of World War II. Parachute into Holland, storm the beaches of Normandy, or fight in the Jungles of the Pacific.

World War II Heroes features:

New classes based on actual roles of soldiers in World War II
Regular Infantry, Airborne and Rangers
Rifleman, Support Weapons, Medic, Engineer, Sniper and Officer

New system for gaining skills and feats based on actual military training programs.
32 new or modified Skills
31 new or modified Feats
Enhanced combat system focusing on small arms battles, armor and squad tactics.
Missions based on actual military operations conducted during the war.
Specifications for actual weapons, vehicles and tanks.
Includes US Army and European Theater of Operations Guides

65300.name: Zoids: The Role-Playing Game
65300.description:
From the description on Lulu.com:

This is a completely free/non-profit downloadable role-playing game based on the Zoids universe. It covers both Chaotic Century seasons and the Century Zero season.

65301.name: GamesMaster International (Issue 2 - Sep 1990)
65301.description:
Contents:

•News
•MasterPlay: An overview of the dark future of FASA's Shadowrun
•MasterView: A host of reviews from PBM to Scenarios, Tabletop to Computer RPGs- From the experts
•MasterWork: An exclusive extract from Richard A Knaack's Ice Dragon
•MasterView: This months dose of Alan Crump's book reviews
•MasterPlay: Fledgling reporter Paul Brown reports from the front
•MasterGame: Geoff Grey's "To rescue a Scarmis" expands on Skyrealms
•MasterGame: A new pantheon for Stormbringer from Rulemaster John Constable
•MasterWayne: All thats new in Play by Mail from Wayne
•MasterWork: The Alchemist makes a Latex axe to LRP with
•MasterPlay:The battle of solefields is refought and Mark Vance is in the thick of it.
•MasterPlay talks to games designer Christy Marx
•Covention, Meets, Club and Contact File
•MasterMail: Your letters and the editors replies
•Critical Mass: David Langford's personal musings

ISSN 0960-1325

65302.name: Noble Knights
65302.description:
From the back of the book

Honor and Chivalry!

Knights are larger-than-life figures of romance and steel that spark the imagination and encourage dreams. Now you can bring them to life for your d20 System campaign. Noble Knights features information on famous knightly orders. From the Teutonic Knights to the Knights Templar to the Knights of the Garter, history's most famous orders come alive with facts, legends, and tips for adding them to your own campaign. Rules for creating your own knightly orders are also included, and over 30 new knightly magic items round out this essential guide to chivalric adventure.

65303.name: Modem
65303.description:
From the introductory description:

Modem is modeled after the matrix in Shadowrun. In this game the computer hacker sees the world around him as a computer system, not some simulated city or countryside. The characters log into the matrix through a Cyberdeck (which is a computer) that controls how they appear, how strong their attributes are, and what kind of programs they can use.

Leveling in this game is how the characters earn money, which they in turn use to buy upgrades and become stronger. They can also earn money through missions (usually to steal information from Datastores).

The matrix consists of computer systems, each with its own address. Usually at the beginning of a mission the character is given the address of a system to hack and the knowledge of what they're looking for. The GM constructs this system ahead of time plus the Artificial Intelligence (AI) programs that guard it. These computer systems consist of Nodes. Each Node connects to another and each has specific tasks. Most Nodes have a rating, which determines who hard it is to use or pass through them. They also have AI guarding them that the character will have to fool or battle. Failing to do these things can trigger alarms that alert the owners of these systems. Then things get harder as the employed hackers from those systems login to try and discover the cause of the alarm.

This game actually does have a "happy ending" for the characters. Upon reaching level 10 the characters can retire. Game over, you win.

65304.name: Doctor Who Magazine (Issue 182 - Dec 1991)
65304.description:
From the table of contents (excluding non-gaming content):

TIMELORD: CURSE OF THE CYCLOPS
An exclusive role-playing module featuring the First Doctor, illustrated by Colin Howard...18

OFF THE SHELF...48 [includes review of TIME LORD]

65305.name: Down Under
65305.description:
User summary:

This small RPG is based on the 1990 film Quigley Down Under, about a Montanan sharpshooter hired to work for a rancher in Australia. It is assumed that the reader knows the setting from the having seen the film.

There are three character classes available: Cowboy, Aborigine, and City Man. The rules briefly cover combat, character creation, equipment, Aborigine spells, weapons, and skills. A character sheet completes the document.

65306.name: A Race for Retribution
65306.description:
From the book's front cover

A Race for Retribution is the first part of a four part series of short adventures that span character levels 1st through 5th. Part I is designed for a party of 1st and 2nd level characters.

The party will investigate a small base from which raids on caravans have been made. They will find clues to a more sinister plot that could threaten the countryside.

65307.name: A Race for Retribution: Series Town Information
65307.description:
User summary

This sourcebook contains maps, town statistics, and NPCs for the neighboring cities of Stahl and Laendersburg.

65308.description:
Pastrengo (subtitle "sound the charge, into glory ride") is a tactical/operational level simulation of the battle fought 30th April 1848, in the opening phases of the First Italian War for Independence, between Charles Albert's army and the Austrian one. It was a small fight, but very significant for the heroic charge made by the Carabinieri (King's guards), immortalized every year during the parade made before the major Italian authorities.
The game is straightforward, with a system first pionereed in Montebello (another TCS games from 2003), and have only a few units on the map (around a dozen for each player), but takes in account fire combat, melee combat, morale, command range, initiative, and an order system that makes this game a little more complex than the usual productions of this small print & play company.
65308.name: Pastrengo

65309.name: Front Ouest
boardgameexpansion: BlitzKrieg (2ème Edition)
65309.description:
Expansion set for the Blitzkrieg miniature rules with new scenarios and campaigns. Machine trasnlation : Description of the war on the western face: countryside of France, Poland and against the Benelux countries, the unloading in 44, combat in Normandy, Arnhem, the battle of the Ardennes and combat in Germany. Will contain the battle orders of the Poles, Belgians, Danes as well as special rules for rejouer the unloading.

Scenarios:
Blitzkrieg à l’ouest
Percée vers Dandzig
Le choc des blindés
Pas d’échappatoire
Retraite à Namsos
Chasseurs Ardennais
Les paras sautent sur Ypenburg

La campagne de France 1940
Tête de pont à Dinant
Contre attaque à Connage
Sacrifice à Gembloux
Hondeghem
Dunkerque
Le Château
Pour l’honneur

Le débarquement
La batterie de Merville
Sainte Mère l’Eglise
Omaha Beach
Courseulles sur mer
Saint Come du Mont

La libération de la France
Dans le bocage
Une journée sanglante
Les Ecossais attaquent
Forcer le passage
Pris au piège
La poche de l’Atlantique
La « nueve » à Vacqueville

Market Garden
L’attaque du XXX° Corps
Le pont de Nimègue
Contre attaque à Nimègue
Route Léopard
Route Tigre
Tenir le pont
Repli vers Oosterbeek

La bataille des Ardennes
Percée dans le Schnee Eiffel
La Traversée des Ardennes
Kampfgruppe Peiper
Noël à Bastogne
Contre attaque à Assenois

La bataille d’Allemagne
Baptême du feu
Tête de pont sur le Rhin
Percée dans la Ruhr
Guerre froide

65310.name: Ambigram
65310.description:
The world's first and only ambigram card game will test your guts, your will and your game strategy while it surprises you with its amazing game cards.

The rules are simple: Each card in your hand contains an ambigram, containing one word when it is read upright, and another word when it is read upside-down (like "Angel" / "Finger"). You can play either of those two words on either of the two words that are currently displayed on the deck (like "Drink" / "Angel").

Sure, the first few rounds are simple, since you have lots of different ways to play out the possibilities in your hand, but you had better plan ahead and pay attention to what cards your opponents have, because the game gets trickier in the final few rounds. Don't get caught drawing a fist full of cards when your opponents are almost out!

To make the game even more challenging, your opponent might zing you at any time by slapping you with a "Double Joker" or a "Double Angel" card that contains the same word in both directions, doubling the chances that you'll have to draw!

Of course, you could plan to zing them back with a "Double Siren", but don't get caught holding that card in your hand for long, because not only is it twice as hard for your opponent to play on, it's also twice as hard for you to get rid of! You had better plan ahead, or your scheme to attack at the end when it can hurt the most might come back to bite YOU!

Simple to learn, but filled with plenty of twists (literally), Ambigram! the game provides hours of fun for the whole family.

About the Playing Cards

The Ambigram deck itself is a wonder of modern technology that no human being could have designed alone, even if they possessed several lifetimes to work on the problem.

Instead, a computer was given the task of finding the words to use for the cards. It was programmed to go through the entire English Dictionary, word by word, and locate 7 words that could all form an ambigram with themselves, and also form an ambigram with every one of the other 7 words that were being located - a total of 49 ambigrams in all.

It took the computer 16 days to go through the Dictionary and return the answer: Angel, Drink, Finger, Joker, Killer, Learn and Siren - the amazing set of words that make up all of the 49 cards for Ambigram! the Game. Those 49 ambigram cards are joined by a single Wild card, for a total of 50 spinnable round cards that play out differently every time!

65312.description:
5cross is an exciting game of strategy and tactics for 2 players.
Object of the game is to get 5 of your colour chips in a row.
Each game a player wins they get 300 points auto matically. If any of your chips land on a points square in the winning row, the winning player may add the value of the squares to their total points. If the losing player has chips on a points square they must deduct their highest occupied point square from their total.If the losing player is on more than 1 point square of the same value they must add the amount to their deducting score.
65312.name: 5cross

65313.description:
The Napoleon's War Series are games that give players the French Army of Napoleon against the foes of France from 1796 -1815. Each game will include battles that have their own custom game boards, plastic figures representing the infantry, artillery, and cavalry with counters representing the special units, leaders, etc. Each battle within the game are playable in 1 to 2 hours. The game uses the Hold the Line command action point (CAP) system.

The first game in the series is Napoleon's War: The 100 Days with custom game boards of Quatre Bras, Ligny, Wavre, and Waterloo. 120 plastic pieces in blue, red, and gray portray the French, British, and Prussian armies.
65313.name: Napoleon's War:  The 100 Days
boardgameexpansion: Napoleon's War: Battle Pack I
Napoleon's War: Battle Pack II – America's War

65314.description:
(From the publisher:)

The Millenium World in Flames Annual is Australian Design Group's latest greatest Annual. It is jam packed with all the latest tips and hints for all our World in Flames products.

It includes:
• an America in Flames after action replay;
• a new political system for World in Flames;
• the latest strategy hints for World in Flames;
• latest optional rules for World in Flames;
• integrated Vichy and conquest system;
• in depth Patton in Flames strategy notes;
• four new campaign (Operation Star Spangled banner, The Bear Unleashed, The Duce's dream and Race to be a Superpower) set-up and notes;
• 200 Politics in Flames counters that includes the political markers for Politics in Flames, heavy weapons units for Russia and China, warlord counters, friction markers, new carriers that include surface to air missiles, partisan headquarters, late war Soviet jets and night fighters, etc.; and
• the centrepiece of the Annual, Politics in Flames.

Politics in Flames allows you to economically, politically and militarily bring minor countries into your sphere of interest during the critical years of World War II. Can you woo Czechoslovakia, Spain, Turkey and Brazil amongst dozens of other countries to help you in your war of liberation?

The Millenium World in Flames Annual includes 200 counters, a 76 page Annual and the latest edition (© 2000) combat charts.
65314.name: World in Flames Millennium Annual
boardgameexpansion: World in Flames

65315.description:
Kliphs is an abstract strategy board game for 2 to 3 players. It features a unique game mechanic, namely 'tile rotation'.

note: In a sense the 'tile rotation' game mechanic which is used heavily in Kliphs returns in the game Zex in a 'lighter' form.

Players take turns either placing or rotating one of their own tiles. If a tile is connected to other tiles with both its hollow, or both its protruding sides, it is taken from the board. Tiles may only be rotated around corners that are connected to one or more other tiles.

The last player to be able to make a move, wins.
65315.name: Kliphs

65316.name: Båtspelet Skepp O'hoj
65316.description:
A roll and move game there boats are are moved along different routes on a sea map. The players picks cards to get destinations for their boat. Events can trigger changes in weather and other conditions. These must be taken into account then selecting routes and other actions

This game was created by the boat engine company and used in their marketing.

65317.name: Företagsspelet Kapital
65317.description:
This is a game about earning money by trading stock. One unusual feature is that the winning conditions isn't specified. These must be agreed upon by the players prior to the start of the game. Various events will happen which will influence the exchange rates etc.

The companies used in the game are actual companies which existed then the game was published. Quite a few of them have changed names or disappeared.

65318.name: Malins munspel
65318.description:
A roll and move game with the need for tooth brushing as its main theme. It was create to promote better dental care among children.

The name munspel is a play with words. It can be interpreted as a game about the mouth, but is is also a name of an musical instrument.

65319.name: Dragon (Issue 177 - Jan 1992)
rpgissuearticle: The Heroic Worlds Role-Playing Game Quiz
The Voyage of the Princess Ark
65319.description:
Dragon Magazine
Vol. XVI, No. 8
Issue #177
January 1992

"Relief for the Referee - Four articles to help the Dungeon Master remain the master."

Cover art by William Carman.

65320.name: Shambles
65320.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Shambles is an RPG in which you explore life as a Zombie. One day you just woke up dead. Now you just want to get on with your life, such as it is.

But walking around as a Zombie just isn't that simple.

It's bad enough that you're slowly rotting away, and that your friends and coworkers don't want to have anything to do with you anymore. It's bad enough that dogs try to roll around on you every chance they get. It's bad enough that you're constantly trying to get away from chainsaw wielding fan boys, government spooks and creepy guys in suits. But the constant craving for brains on top of all that, it's enough to drive you over the edge.

Shambles employs a lightweight system using six sided dice, and focuses primarily on roleplay. You can play it grim, you can play it funny, you can play it gory, just don't play it hungry. The other players might start to look tasty.

Version includes 4 modes of play, a great sample scenario, loads of great interior art, and overviews of 6 agencies and organizations to act as aids or foils to the characters.

Ten bucks get you:


56 digest pages, screen ready
A Very Bloody Cover
Free download of the print version when available


Shambles is a Terrible Idea - http://aterribleidea.com

65321.description:
A Frog's Banquet is a fast, fun, frog filled game of eating dragonflies and dodging dangers. Choose a play board to jump around, choose a frog and jump to it!

2-4 frogs may compete, or go it alone with the single player variant.

Each player chooses a frog: Flecks, Springs, Grublic or Bubbly. The frogs each have a default 'jump' that they can use during their turn.

Each player has a hand of five cards from the event deck and may play any of them face down, adding to a line at the edge of the board. The majority of these cards are Dragonfly cards that dictate where the dragonflies will appear and where they will move to. Dragonflies are worth points depending on which turn they are caught by the frogs (first turn they appear, second turn they move, third turn they move and then fourth turn they are gone)

There can only ever be one dragonfly of each colour on the board at any one time, so players need to plot carefully to get their frogs in the right place at the right time.

In the deck is also a series of Dangers - Turtle, Heron, Snake, Toad and the dreaded Bunyip! These dangers are added to the board when played and will act according to their own rules (they are played by the game). Avoid them at all costs!

The game can be played to a certain number of points, depending on the length of game you are after.

Play boards depict different environments that the frogs may inhabit, for example wetlands and rainforests. Theses are presented both horizontally and vertically. They contain their own special rules - for example, don't get caught in the waterfall!

It's easy to pick up and play with people of all ages, but with careful tactics and clever use of your jumping resources, the better player gets the most dragonflies.
65321.name: A Frog's Banquet

65322.name: Micro Machines Racing Board Game
65322.description:
From the back of the box:

Micro Machines Racing Board Game
Featuring Actino Speed Shifter Spinner

Ages: 5 and up
Players: 1 to 6

Object of the Game: Be the first player over the finish line or the player to finish 3 laps around the track.

Equipment:
2 Micro Machines
4 Game Movers
4 Game Mover stands
24 pieces of game track
1 Speed Shifter Spinner
12 Lap Tokens
Instructions

Summary: Each player in turn shifts the Speed Shifter and moves the number of spaces as indicated by the spinner dial.

Manufactured and distributed by International Games, Inc. Joliet, IL 60435
(c) 1989 Lewis Galoob Toys, Inc. All Rights Reserved

65323.name: Dragon (Issue 178 - Feb 1992)
rpgissuearticle: The Voyage of the Princess Ark
65323.description:
Dragon Magazine
Vol. XVI, No. 9
Issue #178
February 1992

"What Fighters Do Best - An up-close-and-personal look at the warrior's world."

Cover art by Jim Holloway.

65324.name: The Instant DM
65324.description:
From the Intro:

What is the Instant DM?
This book is for you if you want to:
1. Create your best campaign ever.
2. Create your best setting ever.
3. Not spend any time doing it.
That’s right! Kicking back and blowing minds! They seem to be contradictory goals.
Well, they are. Compromises have to be made. The more time you spend planning and
plotting, the better your campaign should be. But I believe that it is possible to
prepare a quality campaign without spending too much time at the drawing board.

65325.name: Dragon (Issue 180 - Apr 1992)
rpgissuearticle: Hot Night in the Old Town
The Voyage of the Princess Ark
65325.description:
Dragon Magazine
Vol. XVI, No. 11
Issue #180
April 1992

"AD&D Trading Cards - Your preview of the 1992 series is here in this issue!"

Cover art by Dan Frazier.

65326.name: Dragon (Issue 181 - May 1992)
rpgissuearticle: Editorial - Those who pull the strings
The Voyage of the Princess Ark
65326.description:
Dragon Magazine
Vol. XVI, No. 12
Issue #181
May 1992

"The Secrets of Gaming Sorcery - Make the most of your magecraft."

Cover art by Robin Wood.

65327.name: Dragon (Issue 183 - Jul 1992)
rpgissuearticle: Editorial - An inferno from a spark
The Voyage of the Princess Ark
65327.description:
Dragon Magazine
Vol. XVII, No. 2
Issue #183
July 1992

"Alien realms of science and fantasy - Wizards, lasers, and UFOs in role-playing games."

Cover art by Mike L. Scott.

65328.name: Azagar's Artifacts: Orcbiter
65328.description:
From the Publisher:

Azagar’s Artifacts begins with Orcbiter, an eladrin handaxe constructed with the singular purpose of destroying orcs. Once carried by a famed eladrin ranger, Orcbiter is imbued with its past owner’s indomitable fey spirit and expertise with two-weapon combat. Now, all the artifact needs is a worthy hero skilled with a weapon in each hand and an abiding hatred for orcs.

Azagar’s Artifacts: Orcbiter features the following new material for your 4E game: Introduction by Azagar.

Orcbiter, a new heroic-tier artifact.
A new magic weapon property, enfeebling
Two adventure hooks designed to get Orcbiter into your game.
A handy reference sheet for players lucky enough to wield Orcbiter.

65329.name: Azagar's Artifacts: Yarghul's Rattle
65329.description:
From the Publisher:

Azagar’s Artifacts continues with Yarghul’s Rattle, a dire necromantic artifact created by the infamous gnoll necromancer, Yarghul Rotfang. Imbued with the awful power of undeath, the Rattle grants many terrible boons to those who pursue the dark path of necromancy. A mighty weapon in the hands of dark warlocks and wizards, Yarghul’s Rattle can summon the dead to do its wielder’s bidding or simply annihilate his enemies with blasts of necrotic energy.

Azagar’s Artifacts: Yarghul’s Rattle features the following new material for your 4E game:

Introduction by Azagar
Yarghul’s Rattle, a new paragon-tier artifact
A new wondrous item, the death rattle
Two adventure hooks to help you introduce Yarghul’s Rattle to your campaign
A handy reference sheet for players that dare to wield Yarghul’s Rattle

65330.name: Azagar's Artifacts: Sabre of the Horselords
65330.description:
From the Publisher:

Azagar’s Artifacts continues with the Sabre of the Horse lords, a mighty heroic-tier weapon imbued with the spirit and skill of a fierce, nomadic people unmatched in mounted combat. The Sabre grants many powerful boons to those who wage war from the back of a charging mount, be it a humble horse or soaring griffin.

Azagar’s Artifacts: Sabre of the Horselords features the following new material for your 4E game:

Introduction by Azagar
Sabre of the Horselords, a new heroic-tier artifact
A new magic weapon property, doomrider
Two adventure hooks to help you introduce the Sabre of the Horselords to your campaign
A handy reference sheet for players lucky enough to wield the Sabre of the Horselords

65331.name: Piers Anthony's Bio of a Space Tyrant: Cut by Emerald
65331.description:
From back cover:

Enter the world of the space tyrant. You are Lt. Commander Emerald Sheller. You command the toughest soldiers in space. Now, on a special mission ordered by none other than Hope Hubris, the Space Tyrant, you must outflank the Marianas pirates.

From long-range battles in deep space to bloody hand-to-hand combat, your strategies hold the key to victory or defeat.

105 sections

Combat Command Book #1

65332.name: Underdark
65332.description:
From the Back of the Book:

No realm in the Dungeons & Dragons world stirs the imagination like the Underdark. This vast subterranean domain holds thousands of adventure possibilities and myriad threats, including drow, mind flayers, dragons, and worse! Entire campaigns can unfold in its depths, and its rewards are boundless.

This Dungeons and Dragons game supplement contains everything Dungeon Masters need to run adventures or campaigns set in the sprawling underworld of their campaigns, including new monsters and hazards, ready-to-play encounters, monster lairs, and detailed information on various dark-dwelling "movers and shakers."

boardgamehonor: 2011 Golden GeekBest Children's Board Game Nominee
65333.description:
A card game deriving from 2009 Kinderspiel des Jahres winner Das Magische Labyrinth. The card game follows a similar idea/story, the magic apprentices have lost some magical items in the maze that needs to be found before the wizard notices. A fairly simple set collection game for children where the players collect magical symbols, while their quest will be hindered by the appearance of magic walls that alter the maze. The first player to collect a set number of symbols is the winner.

Content
1 gameboard
4 game markers
20 magic symbol cards
40 magic wall cards
1 die
1 rule set
65333.name: Das Magische Labyrinth Kartenspiel

65334.description:
Flash Duel is a simple, fast card game that simulates a duel between two Fantasy Strike characters. There are 10 characters to choose from (all included), each with three different special abilities. Landing just one hit wins a round, and a game is best three out of five rounds. Games take only a few minutes to play.

The duel takes place along an 18-space linear track. Players draw from a common deck of 25 of numbered cards (five copies of each number 1 through 5), and use these cards to move, attack, dashing strike, block, and push. Each character's special ability cards add a new dimension to the base gameplay, and create 45 different character matchups.

Flash Duel was designed and balanced by David Sirlin, the multiplayer balancer of Street Fighter HD Remix, Puzzle Fighter HD Remix, Kongai, Yomi, and Puzzle Strike. The core gameplay was inspired by Reiner Knizia's game En Garde.

This game has received a follow-up in Flash Duel: Second Edition, which adds 10 new characters, slight balance changes to the original characters, support for up to 5 players, and new gameplay modes
65334.name: Flash Duel
boardgamepodcastepisode: #30: Design Lessons & Sirlin Games. With David Sirlin
What Did You Play this Week Podcast Thing Week 29!!!

65335.description: Learn with Ampparin (children character) - a fun way to prepare for the start of school! Let's learn to write with included 4 exciting games: Ampparin eskari - Let's learn the times are fast and simple game, which is developing the child's understanding of time-limits by combining the different timing of the day's events. Follow Ampparia through the day - what he does at 12? What does he do at half past three? Move the clock so that they appear to the correct time. Take a card from a pile and play the card if card has requested similar times as the tiles on the table. When you turn the plate, you'll see what makes Amppari in that time of the day. Check whether you have the same image as on that tile. If so, you get to keep the plate - the winner is the player who most met the Ampparin at the duration of the day! Game can be played in many different ways.
65335.name: Ampparin Eskari Kellonajat

boardgamehonor: 2008 Årets Spil Best Children's Game Winner
65336.description: Learn with Ampparin - a fun way to prepare for the start of school! Let's learn to write includes 4 exciting games: found Ampparin together with the children learning the letters gradually form simple words. There are three difficulty levels. Suitable for one or more players. Learn the alphabet and put the letters in the correct order. Suitable for 1-2 players. Make a rally as many words as 10 letters - time 2 minutes! For each letter you get from your point, and the most points wins the game. Suitable for two or more players. Beep! Players raise the letters from the bag as quickly as possible and try to make their word, with a minimum of three letters. He who first succeeds in this, to shout "beep!". Who will be the formation of the first three words? Suitable for two or more players.
65336.name: Ampparin Eskari Kirjaimet ja sanat

65338.description: Learning to animals is a fun and simple game where you learn from animals. Game can be played by two different theme, Where the animals live? and What do animals eat?. Playing cards and trying to animal dies with the animal to find the right place to live or food, when the character wins the animal itself. You get to choose what animals you move the chessboard and in which direction. The winner is the player who collects the most chips themselves. The game includes many variations, for example. the memory of the game.
65338.name: Ampparin Eskari Eläimet

65339.description: A fun and simple game for children who want to learn how to add. Solving tasks, and set the tiles shuffled on the table. If we solve all the tasks correctly, you will find the fun side of the board background image! The game includes 8 playing boards and 72 different levels to do - learn the numbers 1-12 in the simplest and more difficult to solve simple addition and subtraction. The winner is the one gets right all the pictures!
65339.name: Ampparin eskari: Numerot ja laskeminen

65340.name: Tenavataiturit
65340.description: Who gets the first piece of a toy game is to collect all six parts? Gain access to parts of the puzzle players have to perform different tasks, such as evil laugh or try to find the fastest given animal, starting with the letter given. "Tenavataiturit" is a fun and action-packed game in which nobody is sitting stationary for a long time! Winner is the one who gets all six puzzle parts first!

65341.description: Learn English in a fun way! Collect cards by turning them on the words. In more severe version of the game the words will be those which could be used for sentence. Win by getting most right!
65341.name: Lexico Junior Suomi: Englanti

65342.name: Kuminaamat
65342.description: This game, developed by speech therapists engage in oral motor coordination and management of the facial muscles - and, above all, be sure the children laugh! Playing one of the players to bring the card with a picture of the exact expression. Player imitates the look and feel their best, and the other players are trying to find a similar picture of the chess board. Now, make faces! Winner is the one who get their playing piece to the finish first!

65343.name: Hännänheiluttajat
65343.description: If you own a dog, would you like a dog or just like the hair of those muzzle of excellent, this game is made just for you. Chance cards and dog questions of interest to make the game entertaining and educational. You get the chance to compete with the different dogs and during the game you learn these fun tail movers many useful things. The highest award requires access to the podium of luck, tactics, and a little hair on the dog you have much information on! You win by getting the highest god show award!

65345.name: Dragon (Issue 184 - Aug 1992)
rpgissuearticle: How Nemra Added a Line to the Book of Thieves
The Voyage of the Princess Ark
65345.description:
Dragon Magazine
Vol. XVII, No. 3
Issue #184
August 1992

"NPC's to the Rescue! - A player has one character, but a game master has a thousand."

Cover art by Robh Ruppel.

65347.description:

Nexus No. 3 (Vol 1 No. 3) is a 40 page magazine that includes:

Heroes of Olympus

Land of the Pharaohs, by Dennis Sustare - Aegyptian Extension for Heroes of Olympus
Jason and the Argonauts Pharaphrased

Coming Attractions
Loose Ends
Interface - Computer Gaming

65349.name: Who's Who Among Werewolves: Garou Saga
65349.description:
From the front of the book:

The Garou remember.
The werewolves tell the tales of their greatest heroes, keeping alive the ways. Stories as old as time and even older, stories stretching back to the dim mists of prehistory and stories as new as yesterday.
The Garou must remember.
For when the stories are no longer told, then the Dying Race will die.

65350.name: Scortch
65350.description:
From the back cover:

The Complete Source book Pertaining to the Lands of SCORTCH

"We will live in the good lands. My son will grow where there isn't death in the very waters we drink and the air we breathe." -Blackwolf

This 80-page book is a companion volume to Montagar. It details the dark land of Scortch, a radioactive wasteland filled with mutants, and the lair of the evil mutant wizard Blackwolf, who is bent on global domination. Like Montagar, this book expands on the source material from the movie, and includes new mutant species, new technologies, and other details of the land. And, as always, a short adventure is included, which will lead the players through this hostile land.

Scortch is not a stand alone product and requires the Ralph Bakshi's Wizards Basic Game. It is intended to enhance the play of the basic game as well as create an expanded playing environment which builds upon the 1977 animated classic.


A detailed map of Scortch, its towns, villages and cities
A random mutant generation chart
New creatures and plant life indigenous to Scortch
Information on blue Elves, Sand Faries [sic] and Mutants
New skills and background packages
A full length adventure, ready to play

rpgitemversion: Black and White Printer Friendly Edition
65352.name: Misguided Ambitions - An Introduction to Earthdawn Third Edition
65352.description:
From the publisher's website:

"THE AGE OF LEGEND

Before science, before history, an era of magic existed in our world's dim past. Magic flowed freely, touching every aspect of the lives of men and women of the Namegiver races. It was an age of heroes, an age of fantastical deeds and mythical stories. It was the Age of Legend. Now, bold heroes from across Barsaive band together to fight for life and freedom against the remaining Horrors and the oppressive Theran Empire, which seeks to bend the rebellious province again to their yoke. Through noble deeds and sacrifice, the heroes of the world forge Barsaive's future, arming themselves for their daunting task with powerful magical spells and treasures.

Misguided Ambitions is an introduction to Earthdawn Third Edition, a fantasy roleplaying game in a world of high adventure, high magic, and terrible danger. Inside, you will find everything you need to play your first adventure--just add a couple of dice and your friends!"

65353.name: The Legacy of Arrius Lurco
65353.description:
From the publisher:

Several years ago a wealthy patrician, one of the owners of the Reds chariot racing faction, vanished in Crete. He was found weeks later wandering aimlessly with no memory of where he'd been or what had happened to him. Arrius Lurco returned home and tried to resume his life but then the nightmares and erratic behavior began. What starts as an attempt to recover his lost memories soon becomes an epic struggle pitting investigators against sinister cults, inhuman minions and the awesome powers of a Great Old One.

The Legacy of Arrius Lurco is a full four-part campaign for Cthulhu Invictus, set in Rome, Achaea (Greece) and Cyrenaica (Crete).
rpgpodcastepisode: 039 - The Seventh Turn 01 (Legacy of Arrius Lurco)
040 - The Seventh Turn 02 (Legacy of Arrius Lurco)
041 - The Seventh Turn 03 (Legacy of Arrius Lurco)
042 - The Seventh Turn 04 (Legacy of Arrius Lurco)
050 - Mask of the Funeral Clown 01 (Legacy of Arrius Lurco)
051 - Mask of the Funeral Clown 02 (Legacy of Arrius Lurco)
053 - Mask of the Funeral Clown 03 (Legacy of Arrius Lurco)

65354.name: Murder, Mystery & Chocolate: The Game
65354.description:
In the late 18th century, the Duc de Praline sets a challenge to six of the worlds most famous chocolatiers - design a chocolate just for him. The winner will receive riches galore.

Each chocolatier researches the life of the Duc and each designs a chocolate that they believe will appeal specifically to the Duc. However, after eating one of each of the chocolates, the Duc falls to the floor - dead.

The renowned detective, Sherlock Truffle, is called in to investigate. It appears that one of the chocolatiers may have inadvertantly designed a chocolate that would remind the Duc of less than happy times, and fearing ridicule, poisoned the Duc to save his own reputation.

You have one of each of the chocolates before you (happily poison-free). Your task is to taste each one and refer to the background research of the Duc's life to determine who is the guilty party.

The game includes chocolates (six of each - and all absolutely gorgeous); notes of each chocolatier; a brief history of the Duc; and a CD which includes interviews with each of the chocolatiers. In addition, a sealed envelope contains the findings of Shelock Truffle.

65355.name: Diggin' Up the World
65355.description:
From the publisher:

The small town of Aylesbury is buzzing over the sudden madness of two of its local boys: Kurt Caughey and Richard Doggett. Once they were two layabouts who did nothing but sit about their homes and listen to the radio. Now, they have taken it upon themselves to dig compulsively, spending sixteen-hour days turning a backyard into a construction zone. No one is certain why this is the case.

This scenario is a 1920s Call of Cthulhu scenario for a small group of investigators, preferably one of whom will have a high Medicine or Biology skill.

65356.name: Dragon (Issue 187 - Nov 1992)
rpgissuearticle: The Lonely Harpist and the Lady Rogue
The Voyage of the Princess Ark
65356.description:
Dragon Magazine
Vol. XVII, No. 6
Issue #187
November 1992

"The Wild and Unforgiving Lands - What's the largest "dungeon" of them all? The great outdoors, of course."

Cover art by John C. Luck.

65357.name: Dragon (Issue 188 - Dec 1992)
rpgissuearticle: The Voyage of the Princess Ark
65357.description:
Dragon Magazine
Vol. XVII, No. 7
Issue #188
December 1992

"Need Some Good Advice? - Words of wit and wisdom for role-players - for any game system."

Cover art by Larry Elmore.

65358.description:
Each player spins all the impellers.
Each time an impeller lands in a hole you count those points to your total score. The player with the most points wins the game.
65358.name: Kreiselspiel

65359.name: Super Rock Paper Scissors
65359.description:
Take Rock Paper Scissors.

Add ambidexterity, with multiple players and you get Super Rock Paper Scissors!!

The basics of the game are the same: choose rock, paper or scissors.

Rock beats scissors, scissors beats paper and paper beats rock.

The thing is, you have to do it with both hands!

If you play with two players, your left hand fights against your opponent's right hand and your right hand fights against your opponent's left hand.

To win a point, you need to win with both your hands.

First player with 3 points wins.

In multiplayer, players form a circle.

After the countdown, players set their hands to each side.

Your left hand fights the right hand of the player on your left, your right hand fights the left hand of the player on your right.

Expect the 1st expansion late Q1.

This is all done simultaneously; if a player wins with both his hands, he wins 1 point.

If a player gets 3 points he wins.

If two of more players tie on the same turn with 3 points, they do one final round, until one of the players finally wins the tiebreaker.

65361.description: You move your pawn along the course by rolling a 6-sided die. If you land on one of the 9 special fields different things happen like: "You have to suspend one turn" or "Wait until another pawn moves past yours." The first player to reach the end of the course wins the game.
65361.name: Fix und Foxi im Zauberzoo

65362.name: Dragon (Issue 189 - Jan 1993)
65362.description:
Dragon Magazine
Vol. XVII, No. 8
Issue #189
January 1993

"Warriors & Wizards From Afar - A world tour of the fantastic for the AD&D game."

Cover art by Peter Clarke.

65363.name: Baerotech Quellenbuch - Baeronaut / Baerotrip
65363.description:
A rough translation from the back of the book:

Now that the little stuffed animals have become the secret leaders of the world, they want to go one step further: explore and conquer the intergalactic confines of Space!

"Baeronaut"
Contains all you must know about plush space travel, life in space, rules for space navigation and fights. Plus you get maps and useful tips to create your very own unique plush-powered space-taxi!

"Baerotrip"
Gets you back to Earth. Imagine Don Blando, master plush scientist and genius! Here you will get detailed information about his "Baerotrip" around the world, enjoy the hover-bath of Schatarra, swoop with your plush buddies in your giant PlushDirigibles, or explore the dark underground caverns and sewers with your Gully-Crawler!

Plus additional rules for new and terrifying battles with your Battleplushs, gigantic Mechs, built from all kinds of materials you can imagine. And you can imagine quite a lot, can't you?

65364.name: GamesMaster International (Issue 3 - Oct 1990)
65364.description:
Contents:

•News
•MasterPlay: We give an an overview of Steve Jackson Games' GURPS system
•MasterView: Reviews galore from PBM to Tabletop and Computer RPGs
•MasterMinatures: Paint your own armies - quickly
•MasterWork: An exclusive look at Joe Dever's forthcoming "Plague-Lords of the Ruel" in this book extract
•MasterView: The latest batch of books from Alan Crump's reading room
•Snake Eyes - a mini-adventure for Runequest
•RuleMaster: A look at Drink 'n' Drugs in Space 1889
•MasterWayne: The World of PBM through the eyes of great Wayne
•MasterLive: St Briavels Castle sees the Summer Solstice with the Adventures' Guild
•MasterLive Continuing The Alchemist's series on making weapons - personal
•MasterLive:Dabid Phelan ponders aspects of safety ...
•Covention, Meets, Club and Contact File
•MasterMail: Your views our replies
•Critical Mass: David Langford witty and opinionated

65365.description:
(User summary)
Issue 25 of theb Wunderwelten magazine, containing:

news
book reviews
game reviews
coputer gaem reviews

winners of the adventure competition
