65368.description:
(User summary)
Issue 24 of theb Wunderwelten magazine, containing:

editorial
news
book reviews
game reviews

Dark force - rules and impressions
Demonworld - the tabletop
Article on the DSA-RPG computer aids
RPGs of the Victorian age part 1
Felix - comic artist of erotic teddy bears

Earthdawn - Heckel and Koochs, weapon traders

Nemeton - part 2 of the scenario in WuWe 21

Shadowrun - rules questions

65369.name: Battle of Tsushima Strait (1905)
65369.description:
A miniatures wargame intended for classroom use with two teams of students. The game is designed to be played on a 5x7 foot table or any similar flat surface. Free print-and-play paper miniatures (flats) are provided for use with the rules.

The simplified order of battle only includes Battleships and Armored Cruisers; the impact of Destroyers and Torpedo Boats is represented abstractly. The Japanese fleet consists of four Battleships and eight Armored Cruisers. The Russian fleet is composed of twelve Battleships and three Armored Cruisers.

From the rules:

"The Battle of Tsushima Strait was one of the most decisive naval battles in history . . . Of the 45 ships in the Russian fleet, only two destroyers, a light cruiser, and six other smaller vessels survived the ensuing battle, while the Japanese only lost three torpedo boats. Japanese casualties were approximately 600 compared to the 6000 Russians killed or wounded."

65370.name: Get off the Beach
65370.description:
A miniatures wargame intended for classroom use with two teams of students (grades 6-8). The game is designed to be played with 1/72 scale miniature figures or paper figures. Free print-and-play paper miniatures are provided for use with the rules.

"On June 6, 1944, the liberation of France began. Americans, and their allies, launched a massive amphibious assault on the beaches of Normandy. The attack took the Germans by surprise. In some places the Allies faced light resistance. But on Omaha Beach the Americans faced a fearsome German defense consisting of concrete bunkers, mine, barbed wire, machine guns, and artillery."

The game is scalable for various sized playing groups. The Germans receive one bunker and the Americans receive three squads for each lengthwise foot of mapsheet depicting the beach. There are no German soldier figures - just American landing craft and soldiers versus German bunkers, artillery, and obstacles.

65371.name: Kwick Kursk
65371.description:
A miniatures wargame intended for classroom use with two teams of students (grades 6-8). The game is designed to be played on a 7.5x5 foot table using micro-scale tank miniatures or paper figures. Free print-and-play paper miniatures are provided for use with the rules.

"The German invasion of the USSR in 1941 was, at first, a smashing success. However by 1943 the German army was on the brink of disaster . . . Hitler decided to gamble on a massive armored assault designed to force the Soviets out of the war before the Allies could open a new front in Western or Southern Europe. The Soviets anticipated the German attack at Kursk and prepared the battlefield with dense mine fields, trenches, and well hidden gun positions. They also assembled an enormous reserve force . . . The battle of Prokhorovka, near the end of the Kursk campaign, was the largest tank battle in history."

While the rules are very basic, they incorporate concepts such as unit activation, opportunity fire, heavy/medium tank formations, artillery, and air strikes.

65372.name: Kursk: Taming the Tigers
65372.description:
A miniatures wargame intended for classroom use with two teams of students (grades 6-8). The game is designed to be played on a 7.5x5 foot table using micro-scale tank miniatures or paper figures. Free print-and-play paper miniatures are provided for use with the rules.

"The German invasion of the USSR in 1941 was, at first, a smashing success. However by 1943 the German army was on the brink of disaster . . . Hitler decided to gamble on a massive armored assault designed to force the Soviets out of the war before the Allies could open a new front in Western or Southern Europe . . . The battle of Prokhorovka, near the end of the Kursk campaign, was the largest tank battle in history.

The game's order of battle is simplified, eliminating infantry and anti-tank guns. The Germans have Tiger, Panzer IV, and Panzer III tanks. The Russians have KV-1, T-34, and T-70 tanks.

Concepts covered in the rules include artillery, air attacks, terrain, line of sight, and rear/side armor.

65373.name: Heirs to the Lost World
65373.description:
From the back of the book:

Role-Playing in the Mythic New World During the Age of Exploration

The year is 1665 and the Americas are a land of mystery and adventure. Using their ancient powers of sorcery, the Aztecs have been fighting off Spanish conquistadors for almost 150 years. Although getting incredibly wealthy from their New World mines, the frustrated Spanish nonetheless continue their crusade against these native warriors and their heathen spellcasters. Pirates and privateers from other European nations like the English, French, and Dutch prowl the Caribbean preying on fat Spanish galleons laden with treasure. American Indian tribes struggle against their traditional rivals as well as invaders from the East. Combining African magic with secret knowledge gained from both the Europeans and the New World cultures, escaped slaves form secret colonies and wreak havoc on their former masters. In the midst of all of this a comet streaks through the sky allowing a secret cult to open a gate to the Realm of Fear. Welcome to the Lost World.

Heirs to the Lost World is a complete role-playing game including:

a core mechanic in which players decide how their characters are expending effort.
a cinematic combat system simple enough to run large battles yet interesting enough for climatic duels. Players make tactical decisions in a system that rewards creative and heroic stunts, thus keeping the game exciting on both the narrative level (in the fiction) and mechanical level (in the rules).
a flexible point-buy character creation system with optional Paths. For faster play, use one of the sample characters representing the most typical character types.
a character advancement system in which characters gain skills and abilities by using their skills in dramatic ways, satisfying their motivations, and portraying their complications.
a complete sample adventure set in Xicalango, the Nexus of Worlds.
a free-form magic system representing alchemy, voodoo, sun magic, blood magic, and shamanism. Players can use sample spells or make their own during play.
a detailed description of Middle America in an alternate 1665 in which the conquistadors were defeated by magic-wielding Aztecs.
thorough descriptions of the geography and power groups of Middle America, along with creatures based on American Indian myths.

65374.name: Tora!  Tora!  Tora!
65374.description:
A miniatures wargame designed for classroom use by two to eight groups of players.

The game is designed to be played on two 7.5x5 foot tables. Print and play paper miniatures designed specifically for the game are available for download at the Junior General website. Ship units represent individual ships and aircraft units represent two to four aircraft.

From the rules:

"November 1941. War clouds are gathering in the Pacific. Tensions have been increasing between Japan and the US since Japan’s invasion of China in 1931."

"Anticipating hostilities, the Imperial Japanese Navy has planned a surprise attack against US forces at Pearl Harbor, HI. US intelligence has intercepted coded Japanese messages and has concluded that an attack is likely somewhere in the Pacific, most likely in the Philippines, between December 1st and 10th."

"As a precaution, the Alert Status on the Hawaiian island of Oahu has been raised from peacetime Alert Level 0 to Alert Level 1. Limited resources are available to selectively increase the Alert Level to 2 or 3, but extended increases in alert levels will unnecessarily tire men and consume limited supplies."

"Tora! Tora! Tora! is a game played in two parts - a strategic planning phase followed by a tactical attack phase. US players must decide how to employ limited forces in and around Pearl Harbor over the 10 day vulnerability period. Japanese players must select the timing, direction, and composition of the attack in order to inflict enough damage to prevent the US Pacific Fleet from interfering with future Japanese war plans in Southeast Asia."

The game map is an abstracted depiction of the battle area divided into four quadrants, allowing for simultaneous games to be played in each quadrant by different groups of players. The areas depicted on the map are divided into concentric zones - Ford Island, Pearl Harbor, Oahu, and the Pacific Ocean. The map also specifies the position of naval installations, airfields, and anti-aircraft batteries.

65376.name: Jesienna Gawęda
65376.description:
From the publisher's website:

"Jubileuszowa publikacja z okazji 10lecia Wydawnictwa Portal, Jesienna gawęda jest zbiorem artykułów Ignacego Trzewiczka publikowanych w Magii i Mieczu oraz w magazynie Portal. Dodatkowo w książce znajduje się scenarisz Opowieść o zemście. Książka ponadto zawiera współczesny komentarz Tomasza Z. Majkowskiego omawiający zjawisko Jesiennej gawędy, które opanowało wyobraźnię polskich miłośników Warhammera.

W sumie w zbiorze znajdzie się więc 10 artykułów z cyklu, przygodę (Opowieść o zemście) oraz artykuł Tomasza Z. Majkowskiego."

Translated publisher's blurb:

"An anniversary publishing commemorating 10 years of the Portal Publishing House, Jesienna Gaweda ('An Autumn Tale') is a collection of articles by Ignacy Trzewiczek published in the 'Magia i Miecz' and 'Portal' magazines. In addition a scenario called 'Opowiesc o Zemscie' ('A Story of Vengeance') is included. The book also includes a contemporary commentary by Tomasz Z. Majkowski, who deals with the phenomenon of Jesienna Gaweda, which dominated the imaginations of Polish Warhammer fans.

To sum up, the almanach covers 10 articles from the series, a scenario (Opowiesc o Zemscie) and an article by Tomasz Z. Majkowski."

65377.name: Almirante
65377.description: Game of naval strategy and random for 2 to 6 players. The game consists in destroying 5 ships of rivals's fleets or leading someone of the own ones to the opposite side.

65378.name: Rummage
65378.description:
This game is played with some cards (depending on the number of players) from two standard deck of cards.

Each player is dealt 17 cards. Then in turn, they play to the table any card. This continues until someone plays a card that matches the suit of any preceding card. That player wins the trick and puts all the cards from the table, except the last one, to his hand. Then he may make one or more melds. A meld consists of three or more cards of the same rank, the player lays them face down on the table.

The game ends when a player has no card in hand. Players score for the melds they made, the longer the meld is, the more points they receive. Also there are penalty points for cards remaining in hand.

65379.name: Atlas Map Dominium
65379.description:
Translated publisher's blurb:

"'Atlas Map Dominium' is a unique collection of maps of lands and cities, showing the most important places belonging to the Alliance. Besides the maps of the lands, you can also find historical and political maps, and even such astounding plans as a fragment of deviria tunnels sprawling under Kara! In summary, tens of maps useful for the GM as well as the players!"

65380.name: Plonk
65380.description:
This game uses a standard deck of cards. The goal is to win tricks containing cards of different suits from the one led. In each trick, any card of the suit led is a 'dead' card and scores against you, while any card of a different suit is a 'live' card and scores in your favour. The trick is taken by the highest card of the suit led.
At end of play, each side scores the total face value of all its live cards (numerals count face value, J-Q-K count 10 each, Ace counts 15), minus 1 point for each of its dead cards.

65381.name: Dar Drugiej Siostry
65381.description:
Translated publisher's blurb:

"'Dar Drugiej Siostry' is an adventure set in the pagan-ridden forests of Matra, in a nobles' court, where the players characters are guests. Invited to a wedding party, the Heroes find on a nearby, small family cemetary... the grave of the bride. This marks the beginning of a dark story in which they will slowly gain knowledge of the history of the Mornello family, a history in which nothing is simple - either black or white. Private dramas of ordinary people mix with the history of the Queen Mother's country and the turning of Matra to karianism, and to top of that, an ominous presence of magic and Darkness.

The players will have to make many choices - standing against fallen, but once noble people and also an evil, that perhaps stems from good intentions."

65382.name: Seconds
65382.description:
This game is played with a standard deck of cards. There are different partnering arrangements in each deal.

Tricks are played, and then the player's score is the number of tricks won multiplied by the number won by his partner. (There are some deals with different scoring rules).

The winner at the end is the player with the second highest score.

65383.name: Gambit Złotego Króla
65383.description:
Translated publisher's blurb:

"'Gambit Złotego Króla' is an adventure kept in the vein of a dark crime story, verging on horror. It's a big challenge for both the players and the Game Master.

The players are thrown into the middle of a dangerous, lethal game taking place over a certain special game of chess. Five sides fighting for their own interests and almost thirty Non-Player Characters create a vivid background, which - if the players are not careful - will consume them and smash them like cloth dolls. The scenario starts at a ball organised by dutchess Harpburn. When the chatter is disturbed by a horrible scream of one of the guests, it will be a sign that the subtle thread of cynazian intrigues and games has just been broken. With each passing moment it will consume more people.

'Gambit Złotego Króla' is a ruthless adventure, not slowing down before indecisive, helpless players. It is lethal, as much as cynazian intrigues are."

65385.name: Ocean
65385.description:
From the publisher's description:

"An abandoned underwater research station.

A nightmarish creature from the depths of the ocean.

A trapped group of amnesiac survivors.

These are the clues.

Solve the mystery.

A new survival/mystery story engine from the award winning co-creator of Panty Explosion and Sea Dracula."

65386.name: Sneak
65386.description: This game is played with one or two standard decks of cards (depending on the number of players). Each player in turn has two possibilities: he can draw a card or play a combination (cards of the same rank, suit, or in sequence) face up or down. Then he wins those cards unless other players challenge it by playing the same number of cards. Than the more valuable combination wins. This continues until all cards have been won. Then every cards won score 1 point.

65387.name: Ostatnia Wspólna Jesień
65387.description:
Translated publisher's blurb:

"This scenario takes the players' characters to the farthest reaches of the Dominium, the northern province of Kord, Kathard. The scenerie, consisting of endless deserts, sand storms and heat that makes people faint is going to be something entirely new and surprising for the players. In Azuron, the capital of Kathard, the Heroes are going to get involved in a struggle between a kordian administrator and the forces of a local resistance, who still battle for the land's freedom.

The adventure guarantees at least three sessions, lasting several hours, during which the players will be able to see what problems the Empire meets in its way of conquest."

65388.name: Wbrew Regułom Wojny
65388.description:
Translated publisher's blurb:

"'Wbrew Regułom Wojny' is an adventure which takes place on the war engulfed border of Agaria, and also Nubria, the land of pagans and Darkness. The heroes go there to help lieutanent Radicio, who's uneasy mission is to find a prisoner of war. Beyond the Roaring River they will have to face the numerous dangers of the land of deviria, pagan magic and raging orcs. In the rainy and sunless Nubria, where diplomacy fails, and faith is put under heavy trial, your life can only be saved by a familiar weapon and faithful friends.

During their travels, the Heroes will start to uncover pieces of the intrigue which led them to this inhospitable land of blood and fire. They will witness the horrors of war with their own eyes, and meet people with not even a shade of hope left. They will see first-hand that the fight with Darkness is different than the denizens of peaceful lands of the Dominium think, and that the biggest foes can often be found in one's own ranks."

65390.name: Sailing Stormy Waters
65390.description:
Publisher Blurb:

The bloated corpses of pirates and sailors scale the side of the ship. Soon the waterlogged legion will descend on the deck. Who’s the necromancer? Will you find him before the zombies get to you?

Note: Sailing Stormy Waters is a scenario for Zombie Murder Mystery

65391.name: Scrolls of Destiny Volume 1
65391.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Perplex and impress
Impress your players, step up the role-playing, keep your campaign fresh and full of surprises. All of that with minimal work!

Puzzle your players
Scrolls of Destiny is a collection of 10 logic puzzles and riddles for game masters. Print the handout of your choice, trim the edges, roll it up, and tie it with ribbon, yarn, leather, or anything else that fits your setting. Present it to the PCs at any time you want to throw in a puzzle – an NPC could hand it to them, they could find it in a treasure chest, or it could fall off a shelf in a library. It could contain a spell or additional information that will only reveal itself when the answer is spoken aloud. The possibilities are endless when it comes to finding puzzles.

Save time and crank up the fun factor
Riddles are a lot of fun but they can be hard and time-consuming to prepare. Use SoD’s puzzles as they are, or adapt them to your campaign. We give suggestions on how to customize each puzzle.

Scrolls of Destiny features:

A 40 pages e-book with 10 logic puzzles
10 player handouts
How to create your own logic puzzles
How to adapt an existing logic puzzles
25 ways to present a puzzle or riddle to your players
Lifetime updates. If we update the book, you get a free updated ebook
90 days money back guarantee – no questions asked
Customer support (help desk, email, or toll-free phone number!)

65392.name: Zombie Murder Mystery
65392.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Have the time of your life while PCs struggle to hold on to theirs! Zombie Murder Mystery is a party game of who-done-it with a zombie infestation twist. One player is the evil necromancer. Will you find him before he finds you? You’d better work fast, the clock is ticking down to the necromancer’s ultimate victory. Or maybe it is your ultimate victory?

Zombie Murder Mystery includes:

69 pages e-book, landscaped for easy online reading
Black and white, printer-friendly version of the ebook
Online software for game masters – prepare a game in minutes
Lifetime updates. If we update the book, you get a free updated ebook
90 days money-back guarantee, no questions asked
A complete, concise, fun ruleset you can learn in 30 minutes
A scenario you can learn in 15 minutes – use it to run your first ZMM game
Customer support (helpdesk, email, or toll-free phone number!)




Zombie Murder Mystery is for you if you want:

A game that’s light on rules and heavy on fun – learn the game in minutes.
A change of pace from your regular campaign – ZMM is a one-shot session game.
Prepare in less than 30 minutes.
Get great customer support and lifetime updates – we offer video overviews by the game designer, forums, helpdesk, toll-free number.

65393.name: Scrolls of Destiny Volume 2
65393.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Perplex and impress
Impress your players, step up the role-playing, keep your campaign fresh and full of surprises. All of that with minimal work!

Puzzle your players
Scrolls of Destiny is a collection of 10 logic puzzles and riddles for game masters. Print the handout of your choice, trim the edges, roll it up, and tie it with ribbon, yarn, leather, or anything else that fits your setting. Present it to the PCs at any time you want to throw in a puzzle – an NPC could hand it to them, they could find it in a treasure chest, or it could fall off a shelf in a library. It could contain a spell or additional information that will only reveal itself when the answer is spoken aloud. The possibilities are endless when it comes to finding puzzles.

Save time and crank up the fun factor
Riddles are a lot of fun but they can be hard and time-consuming to prepare. Use SoD’s puzzles as they are, or adapt them to your campaign. We give suggestions on how to customize each puzzle.

Scrolls of Destiny features:

A 36 pages e-book with 10 logic puzzles and riddles
10 player handouts
How to adapt an the logic puzzles and riddles to your campaign
Lifetime updates. If we update the book, you get a free updated ebook
90 days money back guarantee – no questions asked
Customer support (help desk, email, or toll-free phone number!)

65394.name: Legends and Histories Volume 1
65394.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Heat up your campaign
Keep your players and their characters on their toes. Every artifact has an origin, every NPC hides something, in Jalgrimm – the legendary volcano city..

Legends & Histories includes:

A 16 pages e-book
The legend of Jalfgrimm broken down into formatted text files that you can copy and paste to your Obsidian Portal campaign wiki
Original artwork in jpg format for printing or use with your online wiki
Lifetime updates. If we update the book, you get a free updated ebook
90 days money-back guarantee, no questions asked
Customer support (helpdesk, email, or toll-free phone number!)




Legends & Histories is for you if you want to:

Add legends and folklore to your campaign
Prepare games quickly but still want have lots of material
Get great customer support and lifetime updates – we offer forums, helpdesk, toll-free number.

rpgitemversion: Capitán América: El Brillo Rojo del Cohete
65397.name: Captain America: Rocket's Red Glare
65397.description:
Marvel Super Heroes Adventure Gamebooks #2

From back cover:

YOU are Captain America, defender of liberty, confronting one of your most deadly adversaries, as you try to keep your country from destruction....

MARVEL SUPER HEROES Adventure Gamebooks are based on TSR, Inc.'s popular MARVEL SUPER HEROES role-playing game, but you needn't know the game to enjoy the exciting adventure in this book. All you need to do is get one standard, six-sided die (not included), grab up your star-spangled shield, and assume the role of the freedom fighting Captain America as he seeks to save the land he loves from the ROCKET'S RED GLARE.

65398.name: The Amazing Spider-Man: As the World Burns
rpgitemversion: Spiderman, El Hombre Araña: Mientras el Mundo Arde
65398.description:
Marvel Super Heroes Adventure Gamebook #7

From back cover:

YOU are the Amazing Spider-Man, sent around the world to retrieve pieces of an ancient amulet which, when put back together, could send the Earth up in flames.

MARVEL SUPER HEROES Adventure Gamebooks are based on TSR, Inc.'s popular MARVEL SUPER HEROES role-playing game, but you needn't know the game to enjoy the exciting adventure in this book. All you need to do is get one standard, six-sided die (not included), don your Spider-Man suit, and assume the role of the wondrous webslinger in AS THE WORLD BURNS.

65401.name: Bethump'd with Words: Book Edition
65401.description:
From front cover:
Games about words and the story of English

From publisher's web page:
The Book Edition of Bethump'd with Words is a companion to the board and travel editions of the game. Its purpose is to present the history of English in a succinct and humorous but memorable form, and also provide more entertaining and enlightening questions about the language and its words...

The book also contains 44 games with 1,032 questions which, like those in the board and travel game editions, are devoted to the comical and peculiar aspects of everyday words and the story of the language. It's a 'must-have' source of supplemental questions and an armchair companion for everyone who plays and enjoys the board games.

65402.name: Bethump'd with Words: Discovery Edition
65402.description:
From the publisher:
...This edition of Bethump'd with Words is expressly designed for parents and children, teachers and students to play together. It tests strategy skills and knowledge of everyday words, including many from the lingo of today's youth, and will entertain and challenge both participating age groups. It enables teachers to stretch brain muscles while stimulating a strong interest in words, language, and, ultimately, reading.

65404.name: Kokkolan laivanvarustajat
65404.description:
Kokkolan laivanvarustajat (Shipowners of Kokkola) is a historical boardgame where players try to become the richest shipowner in Northern Europe. The game takes place in the 18th and 19th centuries, when Kokkola was one of the most significant maritime towns in Finland and a major export hub, especially of tar and timber - essential commodities for the large navies of the major European powers of the time.

In the beginning each player has a small ship which can carry one unit of cargo (initially, tar). Cargoes have a fixed buying price and profit depends on which port they are sold in. Each port provides 1 or 2 types of cargo, roughly historical - London wants tar and timber, provides luxuries and salt - and by trading in this way, players try to amass the biggest fortune before the cargoes run out.

Each round a player can sell or buy cargo and buy a bigger ship (carries 2 units) or cannon, which protects from pirates. Movement is by dice rolling, and before sailing a player takes a 'sea-card' with varying results - a pilot who helps in reaching the next port, pirates who steal the cargo, favourable or adverse winds or a special price event. The latter are also historical, such as the unrest following the French Revolution causing increased demand for grain in Amsterdam, or events of the Crimean War.

When the last cargo is bought, the game ends and the player with most money wins.

65405.description:
Each player controles a group of artists and
attempts to make a performence in a circus.
Before thye get there, they must gather enought practice.
On their path, the players can decide where to go by playing cards from thier hand.
Depending on the location, different artists have different probability to improve thier skills. The improvement is decided by a dice.
The one who reaches the circus first, and all his artists had enough practice, wins the game.
65405.name: Zirkusfieber

65406.name: Wunderwelten (Issue 26 - May 1995)
65406.description:
(User summary)
Issue 25 of the Wunderwelten magazine, containing:

editorial
news
book reviews
game reviews
computer games reviews

article on religion and RPGs
article on names of RPG characters

Demonworld: background

Fianna die Amazone: DSA comic

Shadowrun-scenario: Dead end, part 2
CoC-scenario: Familienfluch

battletech/mechwarrior-scenario: Operation Zitadelle

65408.name: Orthokon
65408.description: Orthokon is played on an 4x4 square board. Each player starts with 4 stones on each of the back rows. A stone slides orthogonal or diagonal through empty cells, stopping only when encountering another stone or an edge of the board.It then changes into its own color,all enemy stones orthogonally adjacent to it. A player looses if he is stalemated.

65409.name: Target Verification
65409.description:
Everyone makes mistakes, even A-Cell. However, when A-Cell makes mistakes, there's a lot on the line. James Fitzhugh is a decorated FBI agent, and a member of H-Cell, codename Horatio. A-Cell is convinced that Horatio has become a liability and is need of a retirement plan. Exactly why Delta-Green is after one of its own is up to the Keeper, but the underpinning facts should be wrong. The agents are tasked with delivering his severance check.

This is a freebie 1500 word scenario available on the Fairfield Project.

65410.name: Burn Before Reading
65410.description:
From the book:

Osbourne, A disgruntled CIA analyst and one time DG friendly has quit after being demoted and wants to write a memoir of his experiences including his limited participation in a DG opera. His wife, Katie, plans to divorce him and copies the memoir along with his financial records and gives it to her lawyer. The lawyer's assistant accidentally leaves a burned CD of the memoirs at a local gym, where Chad and Linda, gym trainers, find and read it. They contact Osbourne and try to blackmail him. In order to convince him that they have his memoirs they read off part of it on the phone, a section of the DG opera.

65411.name: Stick in the Mud
65411.description:
From the Module Description and Publisher's website:
“Stick in the Mud” is a short adventure for five 1st-level characters that takes place in the Chaos Scar, near the King’s Wall. It pits the
PCs against a tribe of evil bullywugs that have taken up residence in a long-ruined keep. The keep, once the abode of a goliath sorcerer,
holds a powerful magic item, the staff of earthen might. The staff has been damaged and is hemorrhaging magic. This leak has ripped
open a small portal to the Elemental Chaos. A tide of mud has been steadily flowing through the portal and into the cellars beneath the
ruins, creating a muddy wallow that is ideal for bullywugs.

65412.name: Good Intentions
65412.description:
From the scenario:
Come on blackness
Let me breathe you in
'Cause with this clattering and din
we are calling you
-Camper Van Beethoven

Delta Green faces a host of enemies, human and otherwise. Some of those that cross the organization might have good intentions, but, as they say about the road to Hell.

65413.name: Nosferatu
65413.description:
Nosferatu is played on a 4x4 hexagonal board.There are initially off board 12 white stones(the Villagers),5 black stones(the Vampires)and 1 black pawn(the Nosferatu).
On each turn,each player must do one of the following things:
1.Capture one adjacent enemy stone by jumping over it and landing on the next empty cell.
2.Enter a stone into an empty cell not under attack.
3.Move a stone into an adjacent empty cell.
Capturing takes precedence over any other move and can include multiple jumps.
The Nosferatu piece has these additional powers:
1.It may fly over any number of empty cells when making a move or a jump.
2.When jumping a Villager it has the option of removing the piece from the board or converting it to a Vampire.
The Nosferatu player wins by capturing all Villagers.
The Villager player wins by capturing the Nosferatu.

65414.name: Anatomy Rummy
65414.description:
The players will be able to memorize the names of anatomical structure and their placement in relation to other anatomical structures. In the affective domain, the students will have fun learning what it often considered a difficult subject.

The object of the game is to get two runs of three and four cards representing the sequential (deep to superficial) order of the five main anatomical components composing each suit. The dealer deals seven cards to each player. The remaining cards are placed face down and the top card is turned over to begin the discard stack. Moving clockwise from the dealer, the first player chooses either the discarded card or a card from the face down pile. The player determines which cards to keep and discards the extra card. The first player to create two runs of three and four cards places the cards down and must name three structures (e.g., three bones, three muscles) represented on each card. The other players refer to a reference sheet that indicates all the structures on each card to ascertain whether the player is correct. If the player cannot name at least three structures on each card, the player subtracts 1 point from his or her score for each card on which he or she failed to name three structures. The player with the winning hand adds the value of the cards laid down, subtracts the points for any unnamed structures and adds the total to his or her score. The players with the losing hands add the value of their cards and subtract it from their scores. The game is over when a player reaches a predetermined score. If a time limit is set instead, the winner is the player with the highest score at the end of the period.

Components:
40 cards

65416.name: All Decked Out
65416.description:
All Decked Out is two instructional card games designed for playing with one deck:
Clothes Wars This game teaches relative wearing positions (toe-to-head) of various clothing GARMENTS while giving instruction in the reading of GARMENT names.

Clothes Rummy This game teaches students to identify the appropriate "Wearer" of various clothing GARMENTS amongst the choices of: man, woman, boy, and girl. Additionally, this game will review the reading of GARMENT names.

Components:
36 cards

65417.name: Dragon (Issue 252 - Oct 1998)
rpgissuearticle: Arcane Lore - Tomes of Forbidden Lore
Dragon Ecologies - The Ecology of the Ghoul
The Wyrm's Turn - Return to Castle Ravenloft
65417.description:
Volume XXIII, No. 5
Cover art by Robh Ruppel

The table of contents is detailed in the Article list below.

65418.name: The Jungle Grapevine: The Race to the Watering Hole
65418.description: In the Race to the Watering Hole board game, players choose Turtle, Lion, Croc, Elephant, Bird or Hippo and race across The Savanna by drawing cards and avoiding unexpected "wild" surprises. First player to the Watering Hole wins!

65419.name: Achiever's Game
65419.description:
The players shall be able to research, develop and use a card game to practice classifying attributes and reinforce factual information about famous achievers in history.

Player must fint 3 cards with achievers with matching attributes and discards those cards. If player doesn't find matching cards in his turn he draws a card. The play continues until one of the players runs out of cards. The winner is the player that has the most groups of three.

65420.name: The Jungle Grapevine: Matching Game
65420.description: In this classic game of matching, players attempt to remember and match different The Jungle Grapevine animals. Includes 72 matching cards, 36 tokens, 4 score cards and instructions for different levels of play.

65421.name: Art Gallery Feud
65421.description:
Given a set of "Family Feud" art cards, the player will be able to state the name of the painting, artist, or classification of the artwork.

After 15 minutes, the feuding team who have answered th most answers and have the most cards wins.

Components:
72 cards

65422.name: Animal Rummy
65422.description:
The players will be able to identify and sort animals into families according to their characteristics. The learners will be able to determine which animals belong to the Amphibian, Reptile, Mammal, Bird, Fish, and Arachnid family.

Components:
77 cards
7x10 animal groups
7 reference cards

65423.name: Ascent: The Climber's Card Game
65423.description:
The players will be able to correctly list the components for a safe mountain climb.

Ascent is played like Rummy

Coponents:
46 cards
There are six groups: Type of Climb, Shoes , Techniques of Climbing, Protection, and Two Required Cards (Belay and Rope).

65424.name: Assessing Arrhythmias
65424.description:
The learner will be able to match acceptable treatments, in sequence, for Ventricular fibrillation (V-fib), Ventricular tachycardia (V-tach) and Asystole, as outlined by the American Heart Association (AHA) Advanced Cardiac Life Support (ACLS).

Components:
41 cards

65425.name: Astro Stack
65425.description:
New astrologers will learn the names and meaning of the symbols for the astrological signs, planets, houses and aspects.

Each player takes a turn by guessing the correct information on the back of the card. If you answer correct you keep the card and you get another turn. If you answer incorrect you turn it back over and it is the other players turn. Your partner may select the card you just missed or any other card. At the end of the game you add up one point for each card you got correct and whoever has the most points wins.

Components:
47 cards

65426.name: Authorware Assassin
65426.description:
The learners will be able to identify different aspects of the program Authorware Professional by Macromedia. Specifically the learners will be able to identify different basic properties of graphics, movies, animations, and sounds.

The game is played in the following manner:
1. Dealer shuffles the deck and deals seven cards to the players starting with the player to the left. He then flips the first card of the playing deck over next to the remaining cards.
2. The player on the dealer's left begins play. They may either pick up the card lying face up or take the top card from the stack. They may choose to keep this card in their hand or return it to the face-up pile on the table. If one of the new cards is taken, one must be discarded in its place. Play continues around the circle.
3. Players sort their cards according to categories of media type (graphics, video, animation, or sound) or according to informational category (9 categories.)
4. The winner of the round is the player who is able to discard all of his cards first. Each of the remaining players gets a point added to his score for the cards he has in his hands. Each player is eliminated from play when he exceeds 25 points total. The winner is the last person left after elimination.

65427.name: Battlefield
65427.description:
Welcome to Battlefield! The players will be able to memorize the names of officers, battles, and features which correspond to five wars that are taught in the course of study. In the affective domain, the learner will enjoy learning by viewing visual images.

The object of the game is to get as many runs as possible which represent three categorized components of particular wars. Cards are first sorted into stacks according to: wars, generals, battles, and features. The cards are not named but contain a brief description. To begin, each player draws a war card and the top card from any of the remaining three stacks. As each player reads the brief description on the card drawn, any player who needs that card to make a run with his war card can claim it by correctly identifying the battle, general or feature and by placing one discard into its corresponding stack

Components:
77 cards

65428.name: Bible Books Rummy
65428.description:
The player will be able to categorize the Bible's sixty six books by placing them in correct order under appropriate titles.

Played like Rummy

Components:
Blue Old Testament cards
Pink New Testament cards
1 Bible Books Rummy Game Board

65429.name: Build-A-Meal
65429.description:
The children will be able to identify the major food groups and some of the foods that belong within them. The players will also recognize the idea that each meal should include food from a variety of food groups.

The object of this game is to build a hand that contains all the necessary food groups in a healthy proportion: 3 cards from the Fruit & Vegetable Group, 2 from the Grains Group, 1 from the Dairy Group, and 1 from the Meats Group. Each card (see Card Design) contains one food item but does not identify the food group.
Play occurs as in traditional rummy card games. All players are dealt seven cards. The remainder cards become the draw pile and are placed on the table between the players. The top card is turned over and placed beside the draw pile to create the discard pile. The first player can choose the top card from the discard pile or a new card from the draw pile. The player then discards one card onto the discard pile. Each player proceeds in this manner until one player has built a healthy meal as noted above. The Water wildcards can be used to substitute for any needed card. The Candy and Soda Cards are of no value in building a winning hand.

Components:
49 cards

65430.name: Tall Corn Trivia
65430.description:
State of Iowa Trivia Game.

Players must correctly answer questions from each of four categories by landing in each of the category headquarters which are located in each corner of the playing board. The play then proceeds back to the center of the playing board for the game winning question.

65431.name: Jimmy the Greek Odds Maker Basketball
65431.description:
The board represents a Basketball half-court. The court is divided into 63 squares that are marked with odds for making a shot from that spot on the court. Squares closer to the basket are marked with odds for both a guarded and an open shot. There is a movement track that runs through the outside squares. Each player has two “court decks” and one “shoot deck.” Most individual plays are resolved by drawing from these decks of cards.

In normal play, the offense begins with the ball along the outside track. Both players draw from their court deck. If the offense has the higher number, the ball can moved (usually closer to the basket) up to the difference between the two numbers. If the defense has the higher number the ball is moved the difference of the two numbers along the outside track. If the numbers are equal, special actions such as fouls and turnovers occur.

When a player shoots, a card is drawn from the “shoot deck” and the shot resolved according to the odds printed on the square where the shot occurs. The color of the court deck card used to arrive at that square determines whether it is an open or guarded shot.

There are also rules for rebounds, fast breaks, 3-pt. shots, 24 sec. clock, & fouls.

65434.name: The Button Game
65434.description:
Given a description of any design location the player will be able to select all buttons from the New Business window that are required to correctly place the location in a workspace -- where it can be digitized.

The object is to complete scenarios, which are workorder locations from typical electric construction jobs. A completed scenario consists of one scenario card and all applicable button cards. Button cards represent the buttons on the New Business window. The player that places the last button card on a scenario is credited with completing that scenario.
The player with the highest score at the close of play is declared the WINNER!

Components:
80 cards
20 tokens (candy may be used instead of tokens)

65435.name: The C-V-C Game
65435.description:
The players shall be able to use a card game to practice and reinforce the use of consonants and vowels which will increase their ability to decode words.

Player looks at his /her cards and, if possible, lays down three cards which make a consonant-vowel-consonant word or for more points, four cards forming a consonant-vowel-consonant-vowel (e) word. That player must then say the word and draw the number of cards he laid down.

The winner is the player who has laid down the most cards.

Components:
70 cards

65436.name: Abduction
65436.description:
From the scenario:
This scenario is designed to be a flashback prelude for a single DG friendly that gained "superhuman" powers as a result of being abducted and experimented on by the Greys. In our game, the player wanted her character to have super-healing, but anything from psionics to darksight to super-strength would be fine.

65437.name: A Cult on the Couch
65437.description:
From the scenario
This Delta Green Night at the Opera is meant to introduce a potential DG friendly, Dr. Manheim Cornwall, a clinical psychiatrist MD who is one of the United States' foremost experts on cults, human persuasion & influence, and the neurological basis of faith. He has had a long career of corporate consulting and university funded research, and isregularly published in the American Journal of Psychiatry, and other respected academic publications. Unfortunately for him, he tends toengage in headline-grabbing experiments. It is his latest research project that leads him into some Delta Green related territory, and gives A-Cell and the PCs leverage over him that could be usefully exploited in future Operas, should they survive.

65438.name: Damaged
65438.description:
From the scenario:
Annabelle Gillick, a one-time Delta Green ‘friendly’, is becoming a danger to the people around her. Gillick, a psychic, was assisting a Delta Green agent just over two years ago when her sensitive mind was exposed to alien emanations projected by an otherworldly entity. This drove her mad and until recently she has been in a catatonic state, waging and slowly losing an internal war with the nightmare impulses that have infected her. Her control is slipping, and her damaged mind is projecting echoes of the creature's terrible consciousness to those around her – to caustic effect. Enter the player-characters; A-Cell just learned about Gillick, and are concerned she is a security threat.

65439.name: Western (2nd Edition)
65439.description:
Machine translation of Swedish publisher blurb:

Western is set in a Western classical mythological environment and gives a good insight into a dynamic and exciting era. Here the role players face cold hammered desperados, ruthless bounty hunters, incorruptible Judges, brave Indian warriors, corrupt Indian agents and sulfur-reeking doomsday preachers. It is a place and time where civilization has not yet reached. Western is also a world where myth is alive and faith can move mountains.

In the shadow of the disastrous civil war, bitterness and tensions remain. Many former soldiers have found their way west with their war experiences as their sole capital. Ranch wars flare up, the gold rush attracts thousands of treasure-seekers, and villages live in fear of large gangs of criminals and the justice of the fastest draw. Western is a game for adventurers and heroes.

Western was first published in 1989 under the brand Lancelot Games.

Original blurb:
Western utspelar sig i Västern-mytens klassiska miljö och ger en god inblick i en dynamisk och spännande epok. Här möter rollpersonerna kallhamrade desperados, skoningslösa prisjägare, omutliga lagmän, tappra indiankrigare, korrumperade indianagenter och svavelosande domedagspredikanter. Det är en plats och en tid dit civilisationen ännu inte hunnit. Western är också en värld där myten är levande och tron kan försätta berg.

I skuggan av det ödesdigra inbördeskriget finns bitterhet och motsättningar kvar. Många fd soldater har sökt sig västerut med sina krigserfarenheter som enda kapital. Ranchkrig blossar upp, guldruscher lockar tusentals lyck- sökare, byar lever i skräck för stora banditgäng och rättvisa skipas av den som drar snabbast. Western är ett spel för äventyrare och hjältar.

Western publicerades första gången 1989 under varumärket Lancelot Games.

65440.name: Ide a Szfinxet
65440.description:
Who makes good use for his Syllable Cards and can answer the questions of Sphinx has a good chance to be first to arrive at The Fountain of Knowledge. This quiz game mixes the baser elements of a really indoor game, such as the knowledge, good lock, taking a risk, maneuvering and the logic.
The players drawing cards from a pack containing 484 syllable cards should endeavor to lay out shorter or longer words which determine the advance, according to their scores. These scores can be grown if the answer for one of the questions is correct or decreased if not, after each move.

65441.name: Hot Spots
65441.description:
From the back cover:

Hot Spots gives you the contracts that you can use in the creation of your own custom campaigns. Sixty-four reproducible contracts are included for all sizes of units, from Special Forces to Battalions.

Hot Spots also includes a Game-Masters book, providing help with customizing your campaign as well as information on the current political background of the Inner Sphere, and the real stories behind the contracts.

Hot Spots is for use with BattleTech, BattleSpace, Battle Troops, BattleForce and Mechwarrior, Second Edition.

65442.name: C Rummy
65442.description:
The learner will be able to construct syntactically legal C computer programming language statements.

The players attempt to arrange their cards into complete, syntactically legal C statements for scoring.
The first player to score 300 wins.

Components:
120 cards

65443.name: Control: The Game of Absolute Power
65443.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Prepare for a unique role-playing experience. In Control, players take on the roles of men and women investigating a world-spanning conspiracy. Characters can be created in less than five minutes, using an exciting system of "qualities."

The gamemaster (or Controller) can create any conspiracy he can imagine with Control’s build system - from ancient supernatural forces playing their games on the world stage, to corrupt politicians manipulating the stock market, to alien cover-ups and abductions.

But the most unusual feature is the ability of the players to not only investigate and infiltrate, but to take over! When a player character becomes powerful enough, they can challenge the Controller for dominance of the game, thereby becoming the gamemaster themselves. It is an unprecedented game of RPG king-of-the-hill!

Control is a stand-alone game with no other books needed to play.

It’s All About Control:
Who’s Got It,
Who Wants It,
And Who Will You Kill For It.

65444.name: CerebralFlatulence
65444.description:
The players will be able to use the card game, CerebralFlatulence, to jump start the creative process and find "fresh" views to solving problems. This game will enable the learners to avoid "white fright," the fear of starting a creative piece, and will provide a method for gaining new insights into otherwise mundane topics.

The learners are enrolled in the arts. The game will be used initially as a part of the creative writing / graphic design class at the high school level.

The winner will be determined by point scores. The team with the highest point value will win. This game can be limited to one round, or may continue over a longer period of time, depending on the gaming environment. When used in a class setting, this game may easily become part of the grading process.

65446.name: Checks and Balances
65446.description:
The players will be able to explain the concept of checks and balances within the Federal government.

The object of Checks and Balances is to win rounds. A round is won by the player with the highest numbered card of the prevailing branch of government at the end of each round. The game is best played with 4 players, but anywhere from 2 to 6 can play. The first person to win 10 rounds is declared the winner.

65447.name: Chord Constructor
65447.description:
Cardgame is designed for intermediate music students, high school age and up, just beginning instruction in basic music theory. These learners already possess note reading skills and are now learning to relate these skills to chord theory and construction.

Played as Rummy. The object of the game is to collect as many major and minor triads as possible.

Components:
68 cards

65448.name: Chords, Chords, Chords!
65448.description:
The players will be able to read and recognize the two standard forms of musical notation for guitar, as well as recognize common and useful chord progressions and chromatic movement in those progressions.

1. Cards are layed out face down on a large surface, "concentration" (or "memory") style.
2. Players take turns turning over two cards each per turn.
3. If the first card is a match for the second, the player collects the cards and goes again.
4. When all the cards have been turned over and collected, the player with the most cards wins.

65449.name: Classical Cards
65449.description:
The players will use this card game to build upon and reinforce previous information about the major classical music forms (e.g., sonata, overture, etc.), composers, and major examples of the musical forms.

Object Of Game The underlining object of the game is to learn more about classical music forms, composers, and specific works. The overt object of Classical Cards is to be the first player to score 100 points or more. Players collect points by
A) correctly answering question cards
B) "Going Out" by correctly laying down a TRIO and FOUR OF A KIND.

65450.name: Classical Rummy
65450.description:
This card game serves as a learning aid to Music 350 students. They will learn to classify classical composers by the era in which they worked: Renaissance, Baroque, Classical, Romantic and Modern.

Players lay down matched sets consisting of three cards with the same composers or four cards within the same era for scoring. The player who lays down one matching set of composers and one matching set of eras.first, wins the game.

Components:
45 cards

65451.name: Clockface Rummy
65451.description:
Clockface Rummy will help students have fun while learning to recognize time in three standard formats: the clock face, the digital display, and the text-based or written method of portraying the time. In addition, early readers will learn to recognize and read the words on the cards.

Components:
273 cards

65452.name: Color Addition
65452.description:
The players will be able to name the combinations of primary and secondary colors that produce white when added together.

Played like Rummy

Components:
60 cards

65453.name: Color Mixing Memory
65453.description:
The child will be able to match the appropriate color cards to form a color mix.

The object of the game is to collect the three matches needed for your COLOR MIX cards before your opponent does.
When one player has collected the proper Paint colors to form all three Color Mixes, they win the game.

65454.name: Computer Go Fish
65454.description:
The players of this game will be able to identify and name five computer components - C.P.U., monitor, keyboard, mouse, and printer. In addition, they will be able to recognize the function of each.

The object of the game is to collect as many sets of cards as possible. A set consists of three cards pertaining to one particular computer component - one picture card, one name card, and one description card.

At the end of the game, the player with the most sets of cards wins.

Components:
61 cards

65455.name: Computer Literacy
65455.description:
The players will be able to list the type of computer, software, printer and memory requirements needed to complete a specific office task.

Players must try to match their COMPONENT cards with the task on the JOB card. When a player has a correct combination, they lay down their cards and earn 100 points. The winner is the first player to earn 500 points.

Components:
about 300 cards

65456.name: Contact
65456.description:
The learner group consists of junior varsity football players who play the positions of defensive linemen and linebackers.

The dealer, called "coach," controls the play cards and gap cards. (A gap is an area of the interior line for which a defensive lineman or linebacker is responsible.) The coach deals seven of the position cards to each of the players. The coach exposes the play card, waits five seconds, then exposes the gap card. If a player holds the card of the position that is responsible for that gap, he may put that card face down on the table. The players have five seconds to put their cards down after the gap card is exposed. On the command of the coach, any player who puts down a card must turn it over. If the player is correct, he gets a point. If wrong, he loses a point. If a player has no points and is wrong, his score becomes a negative number. Players who put cards down may get a new card from the position deck. The cards that are put down will be collected by the coach. If necessary, the coach will check the results against the play sheets.

The first player to get ten points wins the round and gets to be coach for the next round. The previous coach then becomes a player; however, he will need 12 points to win the round after being the coach. Rounds may continue as time permits.

Components:
64 cards

65457.name: Cosmic Memory
65457.description:
The game is designed to be played during or after a basic unit in U.S.space history has been introduced to the students.
Players will be able to reinforce their learning of selected events in U.S. space history. After a unit covering several NASA missions has been introduced, COSMIC MEMORY can be utilized as a cooperative learning and group activity tool to help reinforce factual information that was presented in the unit.

Players answer the questions for cards to their sets.
The player with the most number of completed sets at the end of the game is declared the winner.

Components:
100 cards

65458.name: Country Set
65458.description:
The players will be able to name and identify the countries of the world and the continents in which they are located.

This game is based on the card game "Set!"
The first player that believes he/she can name 3 countries that lie on the same continent OR 3 countries that lie on 3 different continents yells "Set!" & indentify those. If he's right he gets those cards.
The player with the most cards at the end of the game wins!

components:
ca 200 cards

65459.name: Country Talk
65459.description:
The learners will be able to identify countries by their official languages, capital cities and their respective continents.

This game is a variation of UNO. Winner is the first player to discard all of the cards in their hand.

Components:
100 cards
72 category cards
28 function cards

65460.name: Cromwell
65460.description:
Players will learn which "houses" (Tudor, Stuart, etc.) the 42 English monarchs, since 1066, belong to. Players will be more familiar with the sequence of monarchs, that is, who preceded or followed whom.

Gameplay is similar with Rummy.

Components:
42 cards

65461.name: Rêve de Dragon (Second Edition)
65461.description:
"
The world of Rêve is a dragons' dream. The dragons, fabulous creatures, are asleep and each of them dreams a creature ; but at the same time, all of them dream the world. When a creature dies, his dragon awakes, but as the creature is also dreamt by the other dragons, its body remains.

This is a metaphor of the role-playing game itself : when players gather to play, they imagine - dream - together an adventure, and each player imagines his own character.

As well as different stories often interfere (e.g. a player plays different games in the same week), the different dreams (worlds, universe) can interfere; there are rips between them, and the character can go to a different world sometimes without noticing it! Strange creatures can also come to the present dream.

Just like a sleeper has only partial control over his dreams, why would we have nightmares otherwise ? the dragons do not completely control their creatures and worlds. The dreamed creatures have the possibility to modify the dream (the world) itself ; this is the source of magic, highdreaming.

The life of a character is fuzzy between the game sessions ; the player only has little ideas of what happens to his creature. In the same way, characters of Rêve de Dragon sometimes experience a gris-rêve (greydreaming): they suddenly realise that they are somewhere with companions, but only have limited memories of what happened the days before. But what happened can be the key of the current situation...

When a character dies, his dragon wakes up and then falls asleep again ; at the same time, the character wakes up in a new dream, a new life. This means that the character is recreated with the same abilities, but a different past, a different job, different skills, a different name. The player thus plays the same character again. well, not exactly the same : the character is not a newborn, he is already adult, just coming from another dream.

The "sum" of all these incarnations are the archetype of the character. When the character is himself sleeping, he can remember his past incarnations, and thus learn skills he never practiced nor studied. These memories of a past life can also be the key of the adventure..."

Source: Wikipedia, "Rêve_de_Dragon," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

65462.name: Cut!
65462.description:
The learners are Telecommunications and Film students who have just completed a unit on continuity in films.

Given a Cut! deck, the learner will be able to distinguish between shots taken from either side of a scene (see Figure 1: The axis of interaction) by sequencing the shots represented on the cards in Cut! without interrupting the continuity of the sequence. Continuity in this game means to stay on one side of the interaction axis.

The aim of Cut! is to be the first to discard all your cards.

components:
32 cards

65463.name: Dragón (Número 2 - May 1993)
65463.description:
Spanish Dragón Magazine Issue #2
Some articles published in this journal have been taken from the English magazine Dragon (Issue 173 - Sep 1991), Dragon (Issue 180 - Apr 1992) and Dragon (Issue 185 - Sep 1992) and Dungeon Dungeon (Issue 30 - Jul 1991) and Dungeon (Issue 40 - Mar 1993).
Summary in spanish:

ARTÍCULOS:

TU PROPIA BÚSQUEDA DEL TESORO, por Robin Rist
Si a tu club de rol le falta pasta, es hora de una aventura en busca del tesoro.

ESPECIAL DARK SUN:

EL LADO MOSTRUOSO DEL SOL OSCURO, por Timothy B.Brown
¿Halfings caníbales?¿medio-gigantes?¿hombres insecto? ¿y son personajes jugadores?
LA CARTA DE UN NÓMADA, por Troy Denning
Millares de no-muertos vagabundean por Athas, y no hay dos iguales.
EL ARSENAL DE LOS SEÑORES DE LA ARENA, por Timothy B.Brown
Diez de las más mortíferas armas que puede usar un luchador.

MÓDULOS:

LA CANCION DE LOS PANTANOS, por J.Bradley Schell (para AD&D, niveles 1-3)
Los trolls no sirven para cantar ¿verdad?
UNA PELEA CON BERTRUM, por Willie Walsh (para AD&D, niveles 2+)

65464.name: Halt Evil Doer! 2.0
65464.description:
Publisher Blurb:

"A world of heroic adventure!"
"A world where sometimes the villains win."

Visit Heroic Earth! A fantastic superhero setting where ages of heroism have come and gone! A world where the villains are as intelligent as the heroes and just as effective. A dangerous world of two fisted action and adventure where your characters have the chance to make a difference!

Halt Evil Doer! 2.0 is a setting book for M&M Superlink. It is a book designed to provide Game Masters with a fully realized setting for player characters to indulge themselves in Four Color Comic Book action.

Halt Evil Doer! 2.0 contains:


Five new comic book styled cities.
Seven new comic book styled fictional nations.
Six new worlds.
Four new dimensions.
11 New Secret Societies.
Twenty Three Super Heroes.
Twenty Nine New Supervillains.
Seven New Alien Races.
A In-Character Guide to Crime Fighting.
A Game Master's Section for running adventures in Heroic Earth!

65465.name: Dragón (Número 3 - Jul 1993)
65465.description:
Spanish Dragón Magazine Issue #3
Some articles published in this journal have been taken from the English magazine Dragon (Issue 190 - Feb 1993), Dragon (Issue 191 - Mar 1993) and Dungeon (Issue 40 - Mar 1993).
Summary in spanish:

ARTÍCULOS:

MONSTRUOS DE LAS PROFUNDIDADES, por Gregory W. Detwiler
Los peligrosos habitantes de la mar océana.
BAJO LAS OLAS: EN LAS PROFUNDIDADES, por Bryan K.Berstein
También el mar es peligroso "per se".

RELATO:

EL LADRÓN, EL BÁRBARO Y EL HERRERO, por Andrew Millar
Un relato realmente cortante.

MÓDULOS
ESCRITO EN PIEDRA, por Francisco José Campos y Ricard Ibáñez
Módulo no oficial para la Llamada de Cthulhu, para 2 a 5 personajes sin experiencia previa en mitos de Cthulhu. Monstruos en la Sagrada Familia de Gaudí.
LA AMENAZA DE LA SIMA DE DRAVEN, por Jeff Fairbourn (para AD&D Dragonlance, niveles 3-6)
De cómo se puede crear un terremoto.

OTRAS SECCIONES PERMANENTES:

JAQUE MATE
Los juegos que son novedad

Figuritas para jugar o celeccionar
BYTES Y MAZMORRAS

También habla nuestro redactor jefe

65466.name: Dragón (Número 4 - Sep 1993)
65466.description:
Spanish Dragón Magazine Issue #4
Some articles published in this journal have been taken from the English magazine Dragon (Issue 166 - Feb 1991), Dungeon (Issue 32 - Nov 1991) and Dungeon (Issue 41 - May 1993).
Summary in Spanish:

ARTÍCULOS:

MÁS QUE PUNK, CYBERPUNK, por Michael LaBossiere
Los mundos de rol cyberpunk son realmente mortíferos.
TRUCOS DEL OFICIO, por Mike Speca
Diferencie sus mechs en el Battletech de Diseños Orbitales

JUEGO ESPECIAL:

DINOSAURIOS EN GUERRA, por Tom Moldvay
Paracaidistas contra tirannosaurios en un muy divertido juego de combate de ciencia ficción.

MÓDULOS:

EL PUENTE DE HERMES, por Timothy Leech (aventura para AD&D, niveles 7-10)
Turbulento puente sobre aguas.
EL VIEJO KATAN Y LA INCREÍBLE Y ALIMENTICIA BANDA DE CHAMIÑONES BAILARINES, por Ted James y Thomas Zuvich (aventura para AD&D, niveles 1-6)
Trata de pantanos, setas y un gato perdido. No podemos decir más.

OTRAS SECCIONES PERMANENTES:

EL RUGIDO DEL DRAGÓN
Habla nuestro Dire
PLUMAS ENVENENADAS

JAQUE MATE

CON PIES DE PLOMO
Figuritas para jugar o coleccionar
BYTES Y MAZMORRAS
Jugando con el ordenador
LA TIRADA FINAL
También habla nuestro redactor jefe

(Algunos artículos editados en esta revista han sido extraídos de la revista inglesa Dragon (Issue 166 - Feb 1991), Dungeon (Issue 32 - Nov 1991) y Dungeon (Issue 41 - May 1993).)

65467.description:
Who has my crown?
Today is the day of the lion's coronation but a joker has hidden it. Who could have been: the crocodile, the hippopotamus, the tiger or the lion?

In Who has my crown? players throw three dices that indicate the kind, the colour and the object of the animal at the board who has a clue. Looking where is he signalizing, the player will find an object that the suspect has lost when hidding the lion's crown. The first player that find three clues will be able to determinate who is the guilty and win the game.

The game is a children's adaptation of Robert Fraga Croco Rapid permission of the author.

¿Quién tiene mi corona?
Hoy es el día de la coronación el león pero un bromista se la ha escondido. ¿Quién habrá sido:el cocodrilo, el hipopótamo, el tigre o el león?

En ¿Quién tiene mi corona? los jugadores lanzan tres dados para definir la especie, el color y el objeto del animal del tablero que tiene una pista. Mirando hacia donde señala, los jugadores podrán encontrar un objeto que el sospechoso ha perdido cuando escondía la corona. El primer jugador que consiga tres pistas, podrá saber quién ha sido el culpable y ganar el juego

El juego es una adaptación infantil del Rapid Croco de Roberto Fraga con autorización del autor.
65467.name: ¿Quién tiene mi corona?

65468.name: Dragón (Número 10 - Jun 1994)
rpg: Ragnarok (Juego De Horror En el Mundo Contemporáneo)
65468.description:
Spanish Dragón Magazine Issue #10
Some articles published in this journal have been taken from the English magazine Dragon (Issue 178 - Feb 1992) and Dungeon (Issue 39 - Jan 1993).
Summary in spanish:

ARTÍCULOS:

LAS TRES CARTAS DE LA CABALLERÍA, por Len Carpenter
La historia ayuda a distinguir entre caballeros y paladines
LO MEJOR EN ARMAS MÁGICAS, por Mark Galeotti
Que tu guerrero no salga de campaña sin ellas.
EN DEFENSA DE LAS ARMAS DE ASTA, por Gregory Detwiler
La estada esta bien, pero hay otras maneras de pelear.
LO QUE NO SE DEBE INCLUIR, por Arthur Collins
Aprende hacer creíble una campaña, sabiendo lo que hay que usar y lo que no.
BACK ROGER: EL COMIC, por Laureano Domínguez
Los inicios de un héroe sobre papel.
BACK ROGER: EL JUEGO DE ROL, por Francisco José Campos
Por fin ha llegado, para librar a América de la tiranía de los Han.

MÓDULOS:

BAJO EL CERRO DE LOS BUITRES, por Jeff Fairbourn (aventura introductoria para AD&D, niveles 0-1)
Un cursillo adelantado para aldeanos que quieran convertirse en aventureros con todas las de la Ley.
TZOMPANTLI: LUGAR DE SACRIFICIOS, por Francisco José Campos, Ricard Ibáñez y Miguel Aceytuno (aventura para Ragnarock, de 2 a 5 jugadores)
Y pensar que todo empezó con unas vacaciones en México…

OTRAS SECCIONES PERMANENTES:

EL RUGIDO DEL DRAGÓN
Habla nuestro Director antes de empezar.
PLUMAS ENVENENADAS
Opiniones, sugerencias, y conjuros varios en el correo.
EL ORÁCULO DE LOS DIOSES
“Aurea Dicta” de nuestros másters más expertos.
+3 EN CARISMA
Si tu pones las buenas intenciones, el resto es cosa nuestra.
EL HERALDO DE LA CORTE
El barómetro indispensable del estado del JdR.
EL ZONO DE LANKHMAR
Ofertas y demandas la mar de interesantes.
RUNAS Y PERGAMINOS
La magia en los libros que no son de conjuros.
JAQUE MATE
Lo más interesante del escaparate de novedades
CON PIES DE PLOMO
Las más fantásticas esculturas a escala de plomo y metal.
BYTES Y MAZMORRAS
Para roleros tecnificados, dekkers y otros tecnomantes.
LA TIRADA FINAL
Café, copa y puro para después de la partida.

Algunos artículos editados en esta revista han sido extraídos de la revista inglesa Dragon (Issue 178 - Feb 1992) y Dungeon (Issue 39 - Jan 1993)

65470.name: Dragón (Número 11 - May 1994)
65470.description:
Spanish Dragón Magazine Issue #11
Some articles published in this journal have been taken from the English magazine Dragon (Issue 178 - Feb 1992) and Dungeon (Issue 39 - Jan 1993).
Summary in spanish:

ARTÍCULOS:

LO QUE EL MASTER HA UNIDO..., por Jim Shamlin
¿Cómo mantener unidos a un semiorco, un enano y un elfo, y hacer que trabajen juntos?
ESTO ES EL PROGRESO, por Thomas M.Kane
La invasión tecnológica en los juegos de fantasía: la pólvora y cosas peores.
LOS SECRETOS DE LOS MASTERS: AL FIN REVELADOS, por Michael J.d’Alfonsi
Escribir un módulo o una campaña es como escribir una novela: aprende cómo lo hacen los profesionales.
DEFIENDETE!, por Blake Mobley
Una interesante variación del sistema de combate mediante GAC0 en AD&D.

MÓDULOS:

LA ISLA DE LA ABADIA, por Randy Maxwell (aventura para AD&D, niveles 1-3)
Una isla muy chiquitita, pero llena de problemas muy gordos.
HORROES EUFÓRICOS, por Alan Grimes (aventura para AD&D, niveles 1-2)
Los ganadores no toman drogas, pero los bichos caóticos parece que si ¿corrupción en Miami medieval?
OTRAS SECCIONES PERMANENTES:

EL RUGIDO DEL DRAGÓN
Habla nuestro Dire saluda a la afición.
PLUMAS ENVENENADAS
Misivas punzantes que siempre aciertan al blanco.
EL ORÁCULO DE LOS DIOSES
Pregunta sin miedo, que nosotros te respondemos.
+3 EN CARISMA
Relacioes, carteros y propuestas de todo tipo.
EL HERALDO DE LA CORTE
La gente que se mueve en el mundo de rol.
EL ZONO DE LANKHMAR
Trapicheos siempre interesantes.
RUNAS Y PERGAMINOS
Que no falten en tu biblioteca.
JAQUE MATE
Las novedades más calientes del momento.
CON PIES DE PLOMO
Pintando se entretiene la gente.
BYTES Y MAZMORRAS
Alimento para nuestra mascota electrónica favorita.
LA TIRADA FINAL
Se dice, se comenta, se rumorea,...

(Algunos artículos editados en esta revista han sido extraídos de la revista inglesa Dragon (Issue 178 - Feb 1992) y Dungeon (Issue 39 - Jan 1993))

65471.name: Dragon (Issue 199 - Nov 1993)
rpgissuearticle: Campaign Journal: Spelljammer - The Black Pegasus Trading Company
The Dragon's Bestiary - Those Terrible Trolls
65471.description:
Table of contents:

SPECIAL ATTRACTIONS

There's no escape from monsters - New options and opportunities for DMs to torment their PCs.





Opening the Book of Beasts - Medieval bestiaries had some odd ideas about animals - ideas DMs can add to their campaigns.
Crude, But Effective - Battle tactics for humanoid monsters, courtesy of Elmonster.
The Dragon's Bestiary: Those Terrible Trolls - Several new types to regenerate interest in the species.


FICTION

One-Eyed Death - Savor this tale of honor, obligation, and assassination.




REVIEWS

Eye of the Monitor - The Day of the Tentacle has arrived!
Role-playing Reviews - The Force is stronger than ever with the STAR WARS* 2nd Edition game.
The Role of Books - Discover the horror in Roger Zelazny's Victorian London.
Through the Looking Glass - Browse for "small" gifts in the first installment of our holiday shopping guide.




FEATURES

The Known World Grimoire - Explore the possibilities of fantasy heraldry.
Campaign Journal: The Black Pegasus Trading Co. - Meet an enterprising crew of spelljamming merchants.
Romancing the Stoneskin - Solutions to a sorcerous problem, compiled from Forum letters.
The Dragon Project: Dunklezahn - A datafile on the only dragon that hosts his own talk show.
Ready, Aim, Fire! - Engineering the use of artillery in the D&D® game.




DEPARTMENTS

Letters
Convention Calendar
Dragonmirth
Editorial
Forum
Twilight Empire
Sage Advice
TSR Previews
Gamers Guide

Some articles published in this journal have been taken from the English magazine Dragon (Issue 194 - Jun 1993), Dragon (Issue 203 - Mar 1994), Dragon #204 and Dungeon (Issue 34 - Mar 1992).

ARTÍCULOS:

OBJETOS JUGABLES NO IDENTIFICADOS, por Gregory W.Detwiler
Del proyecto Libro Azul, la Atlántica y las teorías sobre la Tierra hueca al juego de rol, no hay tanta distancia.
PASOS DE BAILE PARA MARINES ESPACIALES
Una nueva y original forma de combatir los genestealers en Space Hulk. ¡Con reglas y todo!
BUSCAS TRABAJO, COLEGA?, por Gregory W.Detwiler
Ganarse el pan en el mundo de Shadowrun cuesta sangre, sudor y lágrimas, y algo más.
SI YO DOMINARA EL MUNDO, por Marcus L. Rowland
Megalomaníacos, dictadores de postín y otros PNJ de eso desmesurado, con sus motivaciones y chaladuras.
GEN CON 94: MUCHO MÁS DE LO QUE IMAGINAS, por Francisco José Campos
Primera toma de contacto con lo que es, posiblemente, la más famosa reunión de jugadores de rol del mundo.
D.R.A.G.O.N. BOT VERSION 3.1, por Ed Stark
El más reciente invento de muestro departamento de I+D. Solo para amigos Másters de Paranoia con nivel Ultravioleta.
CONCURSO DRAGON MAGAZINE ¿Y COMO SE LLAMA TU MOSTRUO?
Dos aportaciones más al Compendio de Monstruos por parte de los ganadores de nuestro concurso.

LONGHORN KID, por Ricard Ibáñez (aventura para Far West, de 2 a 4 personajes)
La ambición puede ser mucho más temible para un vaquero que los ataques de los indios y las estampidas.
EL DESTINO DE UN MAGO, por Christopher Perkins (aventura para AD&D, niveles 1-3)
El amor y en infierno nunca se ha mirado entre sí con buenos ojos.

OTRAS SECCIONES PERMANENTES:

EL ORÁCULO DE LOS DIOSES
Pregunta sin miedo, que nosotros te respondemos.

Relaciones, carteros y propuestas de todo tipo.
EL HERALDO DE LA CORTE
La gente que se mueve en el mundo de rol.
EL ZONO DE LANKHMAR
Trapicheos siempre interesantes.
RUNAS Y PERGAMINOS
Que no falten en tu biblioteca.
JAQUE MATE

CON PIES DE PLOMO
Pintando se entretiene la gente.

LA TIRADA FINAL
Se dice, se comenta, se rumorea,...

65473.name: El baile de las princesas
65473.description:
The Dance of the Princesses
The dance is about to begin and all the Disney princesses want to inaugurate it. They will have to find her dress, her jewels, her ornament and its invitation using her memory and a little of luck.

In The Dance of the Princesses each player is a Disney princess and her goal is to get all she needs to enter the first in the dance floor of the palace. In her turn, the player throws the dice and the square where she lands indicates what kind of item must find between the face down tiles. Other squares give the players some advantages or handicaps when landing in it. When a player gets all her stuff, must arrive to the center of the salon to win the game.

El baile de las princesas
Description: El baile de las princesas
El baile está punto de comenzar y todas las princesas Disney quieren inaugurarlo. Para ello tendrán que encontrar su vestido, sus joyas, su adorno y su invitación utilizando su memoria y un poco de suerte.

En El Baile de las Princesas cada jugadora es una princesa de Disney y su objetivo es conseguir todo lo que necesita para entrar la primera en el salón de baile del palacio. En su turno lanza el dado y mueve su ficha. La casilla sobre la que caiga le indicará que tipo de objeto debe buscar entre las piezas colocadas bocabajo. Otras casillas dan a los jugadores algunas ventajas o les perjudican cuando caen en ellas. Cuando alguien consigue todos sus objetos, debe llegar al centro del salón para ganar la partida.

65474.name: Mob Rule
65474.description:
Mob Rule is a card game of strategy and resource management. The object of the game is to take control of the city by means of assassination or economic sabotage. There are many different paths toward achieving this goal, so look carefully at all of your options.

Your goal is to obtain as many assets as you can and wipe out all the other gangs in town. The assets that are available to you are hitmen, dealers, muscle, and businesses. Be ruthless on your way to the top.

HITMEN are used to take out the other assets in the game, as well as enemy bosses. Their fees can be steep, but this is the mark of an expert assassin. Used wisely, hitmen will quickly take the title of your most useful asset.

DEALERS are an easy way to make money in this city. Everyone needs something, and these shady assets are there to supply it to them for a nominal fee. Owning dealers will make you money each turn.

MUSCLE are your strong men, used in a variety of situations. They are your personal bodyguards and can be sent out to any assets you deem in need of some protection. They can also hassle businesses into giving up protection fees, making them invaluable.

BUSINESSES are the most legitimate, and therefore least cost efficient, way of making money. Businesses are in general the most expensive assets in the game, but they are especially helpful because they cannot be targeted by hitmen.

These are the resources at your disposal. If you can use them correctly nothing will stand in your way. But always be on your guard; you're not the only one willing to do what it takes.

Get some friends together and become enemies. Or get some enemies together and become friends. This is a party game full of deceit, betrayel, and the most nefarious of schemes. Fight over territory and businesses, buy out your enemy's assets, and dishonor truces at that pivotal turning point to take all the glory in that final stretch. Let nothing stand between you and total rule.
