65476.description:
Spanish Dragón Magazine Issue #14
Some articles published in this journal have been taken from the English magazine Dragon (Issue 198 - Oct 1993) and Dungeon #42.
Summary in spanish:

ARTÍCULOS:

TIRALES DE LAS OREJAS!, por James B. Couch
¿Tus personajes quieren ser licántropos? No hay problema! Pero ¿están seguros de todo lo que esto conlleva?
MUERTOS BASTANTE VIVOS, por Jonathan Richards
Parecen muertos vivientes, pero no lo son. Volverán locos a los clérigos y paladines, tenlo por seguro!
MÁS ALLÁ DE LA TUMBA, por Tom Moldvay
Criaturas de la leyenda y la tradición, invocadas a los mundos del JdR.
DRAGONES Y PRIMIGENIOS, por Sandy Peterson
Rizando el rizo, Sandy Peterson nos ofrece un dragón ¡para la Llamada de Cthulhu!
EN COMPAÑÍA DE DADOS
Por fin se desvelan, y de primera mano, todos los contenidos de la GenCon -4 un sonado éxito.

MÓDULOS:

EL PRECIO DE LA VENGANZA, por Steve Kurtz (aventura de Ravenloft AD&D, niveles 4-6)
Dicen los vistanís que la venganza es un plato que se sirve frío, como la mano de un cadáver.

Some articles published in this journal have been taken from the English magazine Dragon #207 and Dungeon #49.
Summary in spanish:

ARTÍCULOS:

MAGIA DE PRIMERA DIVISION, por Chris Osborne
De la existencia de artefactos mágicos flojillos, otros poderosos y algunos capaces de armar la gorda.
CELTAS SIN FILTRO?, por Steve Stewart

¿Qué harían tus jugadores si descubrieran un mísero papelucho, pero de mucho valor, dentro del gran cofre del tesoro?
TESOROS INSIGNIFICANTES, por Halina Adamski
Ni orcos ni kobolds se caracterizan por la limpieza de sus bolsillos, pero ¿cuáles son las chucherías con que suelen llenarlos?

65478.name: Horror Rules
65478.description:
From the publisher:

We Put the "Ho Ho Ho" In Horror.

You'll laugh, you'll cry, you'll scream, you'll jump... okay, you'll die - a lot.

Based on your favorite contemporary horror movies and books, Horror Rules recreates those classic moments of creepiness that make you squeal like a little girl, but with a decidedly tongue-in-cheek twist.

The rules are light and flexible and expertly tweaked to bring out the creepy and the comic in every situation. Mom always warned you that you'd shoot your eye out - in Horror Rules you will! The basic rulebook is packed with cool artwork, sample Bad Guys, Character Sheets, a free adventure and 100+ pgs of scare-your-pants-off fun! Find out today why Horror Rules earned the coveted 5 Star Review from GamingReport.com. It's the game that makes you DIE laughing...

Go Postal, Pee Your Pants, Lose Your Mind!

Keep your grip on reality with handy Grip Points: when they're gone, don't worry - you're not out, you're just insane. Ahh, random insanity - truly the spice of life!
Choose from all your favorite Character Types: daring Action, snobbish but powerful VIP's, brilliant Labcoats, quirky Propellorheads, devious Cons, or the ever-popular and surprisingly resilient Regular Joe.

Do stupid things - earn points: At last! A game that rewards your stupidity! It's simple: do stupid things, earn Stupid Thing Points. Everyone wants 'em, everyone needs 'em.
A Dozen Games in One: Packed with almost endless Styles of Play, Horror Rules can be quickly and easily tweaked to suit almost every taste. Play with or against your friends, or both in the same session!

65479.name: Psych Eval
65479.description:
From the scenario:

The Evaluation consists of a written test, followed by an interview with a panel consisting of a high-ranking officer unconnected to the Agent, a Psychologist or Psychiatrist, and a representative from the Police Services Union/Association (or other relevant employee representative body) (These can be played by your other PCs for the session, or used as a way to introduce new characters).

65480.name: Talisman Quests: The Rainforest
65480.description:
Talisman Quests: Rainforest is an unofficial expansion that is compatible with both 2nd & 4th edition Talisman and is my largest print & play project completed to date. It was created to address a problem my friends saw with two official cards: The Pool of Wisdom and the Pool of Strength. Whenever these two cards came into play, those with characters closest to the cards benefit greatly letting them to pull away in the game.
This expansion comes into play when either of the cards mentioned above come into play. Players now have to enter the Rainforest board and follow one of several paths to the pools in order to gain its benefits. Now players have to think about the time it takes to do the quest versus staying closer to the Crown of Command.

Talisman Quests includes:

Rule book in PDF format, Two playing board images, One full sized jpeg for large format printing, 9 Letter sized jpegs for home printers, 60 Quest cards to challenger adventurers, 30 Curses cards for those who offend the gods, 2 New Characters and Character Cards (The Conquistador & Cannibal Warrior), 24 New Purchase Cards, 4 Special Cards (Two Large Legend Cards, One Retreat Card, One Gibbering Horror).

Talisman Quests is designed by Scott "Fenris" Davenport and is self-published under Wolf Creek Games. The free files are currently hosted at www.TalismanIsland.com and on the Wolf Creek Games Yahoo Group http://games.groups.yahoo.com/group/WolfCreekGames/

65481.name: Martial Flavor
65481.description:
Publisher Blurb:

So just where did you come from, anyway? Were you an orphan, sent out in the world on your own when [tragedy] happened to [beloved relative]? Did you learn [ancient fighting style] from [secretive order]? Were you a [menial laborer] who first picked up a blade in order to [grandiose verb phrase]?

Or are you a charming and sly Sijara, wandering the world eternally as all your people have been blessed to do? A wise Ikanoi warrior who triumphed over the arctic wastes before earning the right to call herself a fighter? Or could it be possible that you were once a ruthless, deadly member of the Daikort Pack, sworn to pledge your blade at your comrades' call forever more?

Introducing Martial Flavor: Five unique martially-themed subcultures, with over 50 pages of background and the feats, class features and utility powers to back them up.

65482.name: Arytis
65482.description:
Publisher Blurb:

The fabled City of Arytis has been guarded by her faithful Legionnaires every since the first settlers carved it out of the wilderness. First introduced in Martial Flavor, the City of Arytis is much more than just her Legions.

Want to know more about the city that the Legions guard? Learn about the politics of the city - who's running for what office, how they intend to get there, and who stands in their way. Why do duels happen, and what are the odds on one breaking out in the Council soon?

Check out a map of Arytis, including places of interest. Get a complete list of Legionnaire ranks, their insignia, and descriptions of their duties. Find out what honors a soldier can win, and which ones even civilians are eligible for. And don't forget about the crunch - five new alternate class features for Arytyn adventurers, and the feats to match.

The crunch in Martial Cultures: Arytis is for 4e D&D, but the fluff works in any medieval fantasy game, and possibly some games set in the classical world.

65483.name: The Ikanoi
65483.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Want to know more about the people of ice and legend? Learn more about Ikanikon folklore, and the ancestors and snow sprites who populate it. Find your Ikanikon zodiac sign, or find out what happens when a bargain with the snow sprites goes wrong.

65484.name: The Sijara
65484.description: Can't get enough of everyone's favourite wanderers? Get new alternate class features, new feats, Death Flasks as wonderous items, and a skill challenge you can drop right into your game.

65485.name: The Daikort Pack
65485.description:
From the publisher:

Coming soon, learn more about the baddest band of mercenaries out there.

65486.name: The Elessim
65486.description:
UNPUBLISHED PRODUCT




it appears this Item will never be published
this Item has been moved to (Unpublished Products)
there should be no product images submitted to this entry




From the publisher:

Coming soon, new and expanded content about the Elessim.

admin comment
this Item was linked to (Unpublished Products) on August 10, 2013
after checking the publisher site
the only reference is a sample excerpt page from 2010

65487.name: Arcane Flavor
65487.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Arcane Flavor: Where did you learn magic?

Where did you learn magic? Were you a street urchin, adopted by [beloved mentor] after [crime gone wrong], and now out for [unspecified vengeance] upon their death? Were you an academic at the prestigious [oddly-named magic school] who grew tired of her dusty tomes and now seeks [ill-conceived life goal]? Or did you stumble upon your talent when [tragedy] happened to [friendly group] and now struggle with your conscience even ask you seek to master your ever-growing power?

Or are you a caller of the Valok, using your bardic power to bend others to your will? A resident of the feyveiled city Cailleath, casually weaving enchantments the way others whittle wood? Do you make your home in the harsh wilderness of Kraxal, or are you perhaps a wandering player in the famous Merry-Bedlam company?

Introducing Arcane Flavor: Five unique arcane-themed subcultures, with over 50 pages of background and the feats, class features and utility powers to back them up.

65488.description:
In this version of Make 'n' Break all the architects play simultaneously, using their own individual building pieces in order to erect the depicted building before anyone else. Fifty double-sided task cards are included.

Re-implements:

Make 'n' Break
65488.name: Make 'n' Break Junior

65489.name: Word Grab
65489.description:
The game plays like a Word Rummy variant where players draw tiles and try to complete words from them.

Other players may steal words already formed by other players by crating a new word (a new meaning, adding a plural does not count,) or an anagram with the addition of a new letter.

At the end the score is taken from the value of each letter used.

From the website:

Classic Party Games - Word Grab

Other word games are for wimps

These delightful party games offer great family entertainment with a stylish 1950s feel.

It doesn’t get more retro than this classic party game, with its stylish 1950s feel. A must for nerdy types who love Scrabble.

This is a fast-paced, word-making, word-taking, exciting and challenging game to play. You compete to collect as many words as possible, by either using new letters as they are revealed or by spotting anagrams and poaching your opponents' words!

Contents:


90 letter tiles
full instructions


Players: 2 to 8

http://www.thelagoongroup.com/Details.aspx?subcat=140&;code=7558

65490.description:
The Community's Compendium I v2 is a FREE print-and-play single pdf file for the game Small World.
In Small World, players use their troops to occupy territory and conquer adjacent lands in order to push the other races off the face of the earth.

This 2015 updated of this expansion has been updated to be fully compatible with all the official extension available now. Many of this companion's idea have been taken and used for official expansions (!) so it was time to update it and to bring some fresh elements !

This expansion contains 3 new Small World Races with their Leaders:
- Demons
- Dryads
- Hydras

... and 3 new Special Power Badges:
- Riverine
- Trapper
- Automat

All these elements are tested and produced by the BGG community. This Compendium is NOT an official add-on to the game. This is an expansion and requires a copy of the Small World board game.
65490.name: Community's Compendium I (fan expansion for Small World)
boardgameexpansion: Small World

rpg: Judge Dredd the Roleplaying Game (MGP Traveller)
65491.name: Democracy Falls
65491.description:
From the publisher:

Democracy Falls – a hub of opportunity for those in the Cursed Earth with the skills, gear and guts to try and survive within its gang-patrolled wall. Located a few hundred miles west of Mega City One on the ruins of one of America’s ancient heartland capitals, ‘D-Falls’ is a dream for Cursed Earthers…and a nightmare to the Justice Department. It has always loomed in the distance, standing as a reminder that the Mega Cities are not the only civilisations to thrive in this day and age.

The Justice Department has always turned a blind eye to the existence of Democracy Falls, choosing to use its resources more efficiently than laying siege to it. The appearance of a new criminal game in the lower blocks has changed the status quo, forcing the Chief Judges to take action. This new game, called Bloodrace, is well-known to have started in Democracy Falls...and it just claimed its first Judge’s life.

Now the Justice Department needs a small team of Judges willing to leave the safety of Mega City One to bring justice to the Bloodrace organisers- those who brought the game to MC-1’s streets. Everyone is allowed to enter Democracy Falls, even Judges...

...the only problem is getting back out again.

Democracy Falls is a scenario for the Judge Dredd: Traveller game setting, placing several Judges in a dangerous and foreign city in the Cursed Earth, where fast cars and faster bullets are normally the Law of the land.

65494.name: Decades
65494.description:
The players will be able to identify key figures, events and trends in the United States during the 20th Century and recognize their place within specific decades and the century itself. In the affective domain, the students will be more motivated to learn because they are having fun.

The gameplay is similar to Rummy. The object of the game is to win the most points by creating matched sets.

Components:
102 cards

65495.name: Dueling Dewey
65495.description:
The players will be able to recognize the major subject areas defined by the Dewey Decimal System and categorize books appropriately. The competitive elements of the game will provide fun and challenge. The learners are students required to learn basic library skills.

The object of the game is to be the first person to discard all of your cards.

Components:
70 cards

65496.description:
The players will be able to correctly match dinosaur names and attributes with the appropriate picture and then be able to state if the dinosaur is an herbivore or a carnivore.

The player who gathers the most pairs of cards wins the game.

Components:
20 cards
65496.name: Dinosaur Decisions

65498.name: Divisibility War
65498.description:
The players shall be able to use the divisibility tests to state that a number is divisible by 2, 3,4,5,6,9, and/or 10.

Player must state if the number of the card is divisible with certain numbers winning the chips with those numers. At the end of each round, the player with the most count chips wins the round and all cards played this round. At the end of the game, player with the most cards wins.

65499.name: Classic Adventures, Volume 4
65499.description:
From the back cover:

Help defeat the Empire in the best scenarios reprinted from The Official Star Wars Adventure Journal. Hunt for a powerful Jedi relic, evade bounty hunters in a repulsorlift demolition derby, go under cover in an Imperial recruit training camp, and command New Republic armored forces in a desperate attempt to stop an Imperial onslaught. Travel to the resort world of Kaal to gamble your lives with Imperial warlords and crime kings in an adventure co-designed by the New York Times bestselling author Timothy Zahn.

From the contents:
Stranded by Chuck Truett
The Gree Enclave by Timothy O'Brien
The Kaal Connection by Peter Schweighofer and Timothy Zahn
Relic by George R. Strayton
Counterstrike by George R. Strayton
Stand At Bhir'khi Pass by Timothy O'Brien
You're In The Army Now by James Cambias
The Pentastar Alignment by Anthony P. Russo
Enemies For Life by Stephen Luminati
Swoop Gangs by John Beyer and Wayne Humfleet
The Cure by James Cambias

65500.name: Vreemde Tijden - Tempo
65500.description:
User Summary:

One of the core rules books. This is the 'light' version that is developed. It's made for a quick game with people who like less rules.

Core rules in Dutch.
